title: Account open and Update | Statement Detail | Update URS with new definition level
Settings | Product Definition | Include Sub Product wise Transaction limit validation - View and Create the Eligibility - BE
description: 1.1.1.1.  the user can click on “create new” to create a new transaction limit eligibility form and the following fields are required (annexure 1 in urs) a.        eligibility code b.        eligibility name c.        transaction code d.        transaction sub code e.        number of transactions – toggle    minimum no   maximum no   allowed period type (daily/ weekly /monthly & etc)   allowed period length  f.        transaction amount – toggle    minimum transaction amount   maximum transaction amount   minimum cumulative transaction amount   maximum cumulative transaction amount   allowed period type (daily/ weekly /monthly & etc)   allowed period length  g.        grace period required – toggle    period type (daily/ weekly /monthly & etc)   period length  h.        error type i.        indicators –inner /outer j.        status – toggle (default active when creating)   1.1.1.2.        eligibility code  04 digits only (varchar) must not be allowed to duplicate     1.1.1.3.        eligibility name  30 digits only     1.1.1.4.        transaction code  should be a drop down only the active records should be available in the lov mandatory field     1.1.1.5.        transaction sub code  should be a drop down child records must be according to the parent record (6.1.2.2) only the active records should be available in the lov mandatory field   1.1.1.6.        min/maxtransactions – toggle  not a mandatory field. however either 01 toggle is mandatory   1.1.1.7.        minimum no / maximum no (particular period)  number field either minimum or maximum is mandatory (conditional) users can set up both if required and at this event indicator is mandatory to mark the inner or outer must exceed the minimum minus values are not allowed. zero allowed point values not allowed (0.1)   1.1.1.8.        allowed period type  not a mandatory field must be a dropdown and all active period types must be picked   1.1.1.9.        allowed period length  conditionally mandatory (1.1.1.4) must be a number   1.1.1.10.        transaction amount – toggle  not a mandatory field. however either 01 toggle is mandatory   1.1.1.11.        transaction amount  a.        minimum transaction amount    amount needs to be captured   not a mandatory field   minus values not allowed, zero allowed   any min/max combination maximum should always exceed the minimum  b.        maximum transaction amount    amount needs to be captured   not a mandatory field   minus values not allowed   any min/max combination maximum should always exceed the minimum  note: users can set up both if required and at this event indicator is mandatory to mark the inner or outer  c.        minimum cumulative transaction amount    amount needs to be captured   not a mandatory field   minus values not allowed, zero allowed   any min/max combination maximum should always exceed the minimum  d.        maximum cumulative transaction amount    amount needs to be captured   not a mandatory field   minus values not allowed   any min/max combination maximum should always exceed the minimum  note: users can set up both if required and at this event indicator is mandatory to mark the inner or outer  allowed period type not a mandatory field must be a dropdown and all active period types must be picked allowed period length conditionally mandatory (6.1.2.4) must be a number   1.1.1.12.        grace period required – toggle  not a mandatory field   1.1.1.13.        period type (conditional mandatory 1.1.1.8)  not a mandatory field must be a dropdown and all active period types must be picked   1.1.1.14.        period length (conditional mandatory 6.1.2.8)  conditionally mandatory (1.1.1.6) must be a number   1.1.1.15.        indicator  radio button or check box inner – min/max values consider in between outer   min/max values consider not in between   1.1.1.16.        error type  mandatory enum value (ui) exception – only a warning needs to be displayed error – the system must not allow to performing of any transaction  note: error type is required for 1.1.1.6, 1.1.1.7 (a,b)  note: please refer to annexure 03 for a detailed screen  use case as follows: if the user set up the limits for transaction code; cash withdrawal transaction sub code; over the counter withdrawal period type; month period length; 1 minimum number; 2 maximum number; 3 error type; error  the system should not allow passing the min/max values and based on the error type for a month. further, if any charge is set up the same needs to be calculated accordingly. this will be similar to all the min/max value setups. in the event of any combined values (min/max), the validation should fire based on the indicator inner: between min and max values outer:  not in between the min and max values  by selecting the “confirm” button, the user gets a message as “are you sure you want to create the limit eligibility type?” with the “confirm” or “cancel” buttons  a.        confirm: if the user selects the “confirm” option, the limit eligibility type must be created, and the message to display as “limit eligibility type successfully created!” upon successful transfer. b.        cancel: if the user selects the “cancel” option, the message will be discarded if any error has occurred while creating the record the correct error message needs to display to the user.   1.1.1.17.         the same should be available in the update screen as well as user can update this as and when required  1.1.1.18.         the user can enter any combination of the above scenarios     check:   the user should be able to create according to the input parameters  user can modify this where required (in sub product level of limit eligibility type level)  the system must show proper error message /proper validation when the user performs any transaction to an account in the above sub product according to the sub transaction type limits  user can add multiple transaction codes/sub codes based on the requirement and update/remove when required in the eligibility controller  when attaching the eligibility limit system must display the code, name, and status of the eligibility limit type  once the user setup the template a field is required to be attached at the eligibility controller level (annexure 2/3)  once the user attaches the template to the controller (active only) then can assign it to the sub product as the existing eligibility type (existing)  if the user provides unrelated or non existing data for selected search parameters, then details will not display, and the message be displayed as “no data”.  the system must not allow attaching duplicate sub transaction codes to a single eligibility type  system must not allow to attach the same transaction eligibility at sub product level in multiple times  the users are allowed to create multiple limit eligibility templates using the same transaction sub types

title: Standing Order | SI Suspend |Confirming standing order - Confirm QA
description: do      user select the confirm standing order option it will navigate to “confirm standing order” page.    “hold pending” tab should be added to the existing screen.     after holding the standing order, it will park on the “hold pending tab”     hold standing order should be searched by the casa account number as the search parameter.     under the standing order details section, below already added details related to relevant standing order should be displayed in disable mode.     in the last section named as standing order hold details, below fields should be displayed.    selected hold time period from   selected hold time period to   added comment   uploaded document     user should be able to approve or reject the hold request of standing order.     check     user select the confirm standing order option it will navigate to “temporary hold standing order” page.   “hold pending” tab should be added to the existing screen.     after holding the standing order, it will park on the “hold pending tab”    hold standing order should be searched by the casa account number as the search parameter.   after searching by the casa account number standing order details should be displayed in the grid with following columns.    customer name   account number   account name   action [select]   after selecting the standing order, order details display under three section.    account details   standing order details   standing order hold details   under the account details section, in a grid below details should be displayed.    schema name   account number   name   status    under the standing order details section, below already added details related to relevant standing order should be displayed in disable mode.     when user selects “fix” as standing order type, below details should be displayed in a disable mode.    first payment amount   recurring payment date   recurring payment amount   frequency   total number of payments   final payment amount   priority   processing type   payment mode   account types   notes   attached document    .    when user selects “condition” as standing order type, below details should be displayed in a disable mode.    account number   amount type   account balance conditions   account balance amount   account balance indicator   account balance indicator type   notes   attached document    in the last section named as standing order hold details, below fields should be displayed.    selected hold time period from   selected hold time period to   added comment   uploaded document     user should be able to approve or reject the hold request of standing order.

title: Remittances | FCY Draft Issuance | FCY Confirmation Counter - Frontend/QA
description: do    counter cash fcy confirmation     user should be able to see the pending confirmation fcy cheque   user able to select require transaction.   the entered details will display. confirmation user cannot edit the transaction details.   based on the data user able to make the decision.   if approved user able to print the cheque. the transaction should be applied t0 the transaction table.   based on the gl mapping the double entry need to create. ( temporary entry need to process)    if user select reject option transaction need to reject.    confirm user, date and branch should update.    fcy need to create, and transaction should be under approve status.    data should be updating relevant tables.   check    after approve transaction should be apply to transaction table    transaction pending status need to change to approved status.    if rejected transaction should be reverse and status should be update as rejected.    confirm user, date and branch should update.    fcy need to create, and transaction should be under approve g status.    gl entry should be apply.   data should be updating relevant tables.

title: Remittances | FCY Draft Issuance | FCY Creation Counter - Frontend/QA
description: do    if user selected counter cash deposit. the system should map with cash in hand account. the collected amount will be deposited to this account.   user should be able to select the cheque creation bank.   user should be able to enter the local amount. the value should be validate based on thousand separators and decimal places should be based on currency master and currency exchange rate.   user able to select the required currency and user able to see the latest currency exchange rate.   cheque amount should be calculated based on the local amount.   user should be able to enter the cheque number.   user should be able to enter any reference number if required.   if user need to enter any note, user can add the note in note field.   created user, date and branch should update.   fcy need to create, and transaction should be under pending status.   data should be updating relevant tables.  check    transaction should be created.   mapping charges should be calculated based on cash management product charges.   tax calculation should be calculated based on the customer tax profile.   created user, date and branch should update.   fcy need to create, and transaction should be under pending status.   data should be updating relevant tables.

Settings | Product Definition | Include Sub Product wise Transaction limit validation - View and Create the Eligibility -FE
description: 1.1.1.1.  the user can click on “create new” to create a new transaction limit eligibility form and the following fields are required (annexure 1 in urs) a. eligibility code b. eligibility name c. transaction code d. transaction sub code e. number of transactions – toggle • minimum no • maximum no • allowed period type (daily/ weekly /monthly & etc) • allowed period length f. transaction amount – toggle • minimum transaction amount • maximum transaction amount • minimum cumulative transaction amount • maximum cumulative transaction amount • allowed period type (daily/ weekly /monthly & etc) • allowed period length g. grace period required – toggle • period type (daily/ weekly /monthly & etc) • period length h. error type i. indicators –inner /outer j. status – toggle (default active when creating)   1.1.1.2. eligibility code  04 digits only (varchar) must not be allowed to duplicate    1.1.1.3. eligibility name  30 digits only    1.1.1.4. transaction code  should be a drop down only the active records should be available in the lov mandatory field    1.1.1.5. transaction sub code  should be a drop down child records must be according to the parent record (6.1.2.2) only the active records should be available in the lov mandatory field   1.1.1.6. min/maxtransactions – toggle  not a mandatory field. however either 01 toggle is mandatory   1.1.1.7. minimum no / maximum no (particular period)  number field either minimum or maximum is mandatory (conditional) users can set up both if required and at this event indicator is mandatory to mark the inner or outer must exceed the minimum minus values are not allowed. zero allowed point values not allowed (0.1)   1.1.1.8. allowed period type  not a mandatory field must be a dropdown and all active period types must be picked   1.1.1.9. allowed period length  conditionally mandatory (1.1.1.4) must be a number   1.1.1.10. transaction amount – toggle  not a mandatory field. however either 01 toggle is mandatory   1.1.1.11. transaction amount  a. minimum transaction amount • amount needs to be captured • not a mandatory field • minus values not allowed, zero allowed • any min/max combination maximum should always exceed the minimum  b. maximum transaction amount • amount needs to be captured • not a mandatory field • minus values not allowed • any min/max combination maximum should always exceed the minimum note: users can set up both if required and at this event indicator is mandatory to mark the inner or outer  c. minimum cumulative transaction amount • amount needs to be captured • not a mandatory field • minus values not allowed, zero allowed • any min/max combination maximum should always exceed the minimum  d. maximum cumulative transaction amount • amount needs to be captured • not a mandatory field • minus values not allowed • any min/max combination maximum should always exceed the minimum note: users can set up both if required and at this event indicator is mandatory to mark the inner or outer  allowed period type not a mandatory field must be a dropdown and all active period types must be picked allowed period length conditionally mandatory (6.1.2.4) must be a number   1.1.1.12. grace period required – toggle  not a mandatory field   1.1.1.13. period type (conditional mandatory 1.1.1.8)  not a mandatory field must be a dropdown and all active period types must be picked   1.1.1.14. period length (conditional mandatory 6.1.2.8)  conditionally mandatory (1.1.1.6) must be a number   1.1.1.15. indicator  radio button or check box inner – min/max values consider in between outer   min/max values consider not in between   1.1.1.16. error type  mandatory enum value (ui) exception – only a warning needs to be displayed error – the system must not allow to performing of any transaction  note: error type is required for 1.1.1.6, 1.1.1.7 (a,b)  note: please refer to annexure 03 for a detailed screen  use case as follows: if the user set up the limits for transaction code; cash withdrawal transaction sub code; over the counter withdrawal period type; month period length; 1 minimum number; 2 maximum number; 3 error type; error  the system should not allow passing the min/max values and based on the error type for a month. further, if any charge is set up the same needs to be calculated accordingly. this will be similar to all the min/max value setups. in the event of any combined values (min/max), the validation should fire based on the indicator inner: between min and max values outer:  not in between the min and max values  by selecting the “confirm” button, the user gets a message as “are you sure you want to create the limit eligibility type?” with the “confirm” or “cancel” buttons  a. confirm: if the user selects the “confirm” option, the limit eligibility type must be created, and the message to display as “limit eligibility type successfully created!” upon successful transfer. b. cancel: if the user selects the “cancel” option, the message will be discarded if any error has occurred while creating the record the correct error message needs to display to the user.   1.1.1.17.  the same should be available in the update screen as well as user can update this as and when required  1.1.1.18.  the user can enter any combination of the above scenarios     check:   the user should be able to create according to the input parameters  user can modify this where required (in sub product level of limit eligibility type level)  the system must show proper error message /proper validation when the user performs any transaction to an account in the above sub product according to the sub transaction type limits  user can add multiple transaction codes/sub codes based on the requirement and update/remove when required in the eligibility controller  when attaching the eligibility limit system must display the code, name, and status of the eligibility limit type  once the user setup the template a field is required to be attached at the eligibility controller level (annexure 2/3)  once the user attaches the template to the controller (active only) then can assign it to the sub product as the existing eligibility type (existing)  if the user provides unrelated or non existing data for selected search parameters, then details will not display, and the message be displayed as “no data”.  the system must not allow attaching duplicate sub transaction codes to a single eligibility type  system must not allow to attach the same transaction eligibility at sub product level in multiple times  the users are allowed to create multiple limit eligibility templates using the same transaction sub types

TD Module | Enable Non Customer receipt for TD opening | (Screen 4)
description: do:    user selects the ‘opening account’ option from the dashboard, which is then navigated to the customer onboarding process in the td.  user can select a customer from the ‘existing customer’ option, user can search the customer using the following parameters,  # customer name # customer identification number # customer reference code # customer business registration number     user have to select a customer and then the onboarding process will start.   in the process there are steppers and in the ‘collection details’ stepper is where the new function is added    in there the user should click on the “add collection details” and then a pop should be displayed.   where the user should select a ‘amount type’, it should be either ‘account’ or ‘transaction’.   the collection type can be selected from, ‘cash’ ‘fund transfer’.   a new option as ‘customer receipts’ should be added to that drop down.   when the user selects the ‘customer receipts’ there should be a dynamic change in the pop up and should show a search option to select customer receipts.  please note that the receipts shown here are the, general receipts that have been issued against the customer in the teller module – general receipting function.   when clicked on the search, a pop up window should be shown to select, the receipts can be searched by the following parameters,  # receipts number # customer name   if the user does not use the search, all the receipts should load in the grid with the following headers,  # customer name # receipt number # receipt date # branch # amount # receipt collection type # action     user then can select the necessary receipts (multiple select) and then it will be displayed in the table in the main pop up window with the following headers,  # receipt number # receipt date # amount   once all the receipts are selected in the table the total should be displayed, meaning the total of all the receipts should be displayed and should then be added to the ‘capital amount’, user must enter the total value to the ‘capital amount’ already entered amount in the ‘account details’ stepper should also be added.   once that is done user can click on the ‘add details’ button, then the amount will be shown in a grid. and the user can click on finish to create a td account to this user      check:    check if the user can select the search parameters in the customer search  check if the user can start the onboarding process  check if the user can move to the “collection details“ stepper  check if the user can 'add collection details' and then it should pop up  check if the user can select the ‘account type' and 'collection type’  check if the screen dynamically change if the customer selects 'customer receipts'  check if the user can search the general receipts from the search pop up window and the select multiple  check if the selected receipts are shown in the table inside of the pop up window  check if the total amount is calculated as for the amount of receipts are selected  check if the user can add the capital amount to the 'capital amount' numeric field and then user should be able to add the details successfully.

Yard Module | Post Yard Management | Settlement Letter Print | Developing a new Functionality | Test Case writing and Execution
description: new functionality:     existing functionality:  currently, in the yard module, there is an option to generate settlement letters when a vehicle is taken in. ("yard in")   new requirement:  the new requirement is to add a "download" button alongside the existing "print" button.   column name change:  the current column in the settlement letter ui that contains the "print" column should be modified to display "print / download."   user interaction:  users will be able to select one or more records in the ui of “settlement letter print”.   download action:  when the user selects records and clicks "download," the system will perform the following actions:   data extraction:  the system will extract the details of the selected records.   excel sheet creation:  the extracted data will be organized into an excel spreadsheet. the spreadsheet should have specific columns to match the required format.   fusion system update:  simultaneously, the system will update the fusion system as “settlement letter on” to indicate that settlement letters have been downloaded for the selected records.   purpose:    the main purpose of this feature is to allow users to efficiently download multiple records in bulk. the downloaded data can then be sent to another system for mass printing, making the process more streamlined and convenient.

description: path:   login  > lending module  > origination dashboard  > process a lead that is in ‘in progress’ status   do:                                                   effective rate should be calculated based on the flat rate, loan amount. instalment amount, term, and repayment frequency   calculated effective amount should be displayed in the non editable mode under the ‘effective rate’ field under the ‘loan calculation’ of the loan appraisal   check:     whether the calculation happens correctly   whether the effective rate is displayed under the correct input parameter in the front end

title: Loan Origination | Loan Creation | Flat Rate Incorporation in TC | Story I – Add a new input field as ‘Interest Rate Type’ at the Creation of New Tier Band Set
description: path :  login  > lending module  > settings  > interest template settings  > search for an existing interest template  > view tier band  > add new tier band set   do:     under the ‘tier band set’ screen of update and creation, a new input field should be added named ‘interest rate type’.   the user should be able to select either ‘flat rate’ or ‘effective rate’ as the ‘interest rate type’ when creating a new tier band set.   that interest rate type should be applied for all the existing tier band records that are mapped for the particular tier band set.   value that has been entered to the ‘loan provider interest rate’ under the ‘tier band details’ should be applied for the loan calculation based on the interest type.                                  if the interest type is ‘flat rate’; then the value entered for the ‘loan provider interest rate’ should be applied for the flat rate                                  if the interest type is ‘effective rate’; then the value entered for the ‘loan provider interest rate’ should be applied for the effective rate    existing input field named ‘interest rate type’ under the ‘tier band details’ screen needs to be removed.      check:     whether the ‘interest rate type’ under the ‘tier band details’ screen needs to be removed.   whether the new input field named ‘interest rate type’ is available under the ‘tier band set’ screen of creation.   check whether the new input field ‘interest rate type ’is mandatory.   check whether proper error messages are shown when a user has not selected the ‘interest rate type’.   whether two values as ‘effective rate’ and ‘flat rate’ are available under the ‘interest rate type’ as a dropdown list.   whether the selected interest type is applied for all the existing tier band records that are mapped for the particular tier band set.        update function   path:   login  > lending module  > settings  > interest template settings  > search for an existing interest template  > view tier band  > search for an existing tier band  > update tier band   do:     under the ‘tier band set’ screen of update, a new input field should be added named ‘interest rate type’.   the user should be able to select either ‘flat rate’ or ‘effective rate’ as the ‘interest rate type’ when updating a tier band set.   that interest rate type should be applied for all the existing tier band records that are mapped for the particular tier band set.   value that has been entered to the ‘loan provider interest rate’ under the ‘tier band details’ should be applied for the loan calculation based on the interest type.    if the interest type is ‘flat rate’; then the value entered for the ‘loan provider interest rate’ should be applied for the flat rate    if the interest type is ‘effective rate’; then the value entered for the ‘loan provider interest rate’ should be applied for the effective rate    existing input field named ‘interest rate type’ under the ‘tier band details’ screen needs to be removed.      check:     whether the ‘interest rate type’ under the ‘tier band details’ screen needs to be removed.   whether the new input field named ‘interest rate type’ is available under the ‘tier band set’ screen of update.   check whether the new input field ‘interest rate type ’is mandatory.   check whether proper error messages are shown when a user has not selected the ‘interest rate type’.   whether two values as ‘effective rate’ and ‘flat rate’ are available under the ‘interest rate type’ as a dropdown list.   whether the selected interest type is applied for all the existing tier band records that are mapped for the particular tier band set.

title: Account Module | Exception Handling | Transaction Exception Triggering  | Actual posted amount not equal to defined fee (AANE)
description: do:    hardcode exception sub codes in the backend:   implement the following exception sub codes in the backend (be):  main code   abex (account balance exception)  sub code:    aane   actual posted amount not equal to defined fee   implement exception triggering:   refer to the exception triggering process flowchart for detailed steps.  trigger the appropriate exception with its sub code when the following conditions occur.    aane   confirm that transaction details are updated in exception table when the actual posted amount not equal to defined fee charge details amount   counter cash withdrawal / deposit   cheque withdrawal / deposit   fund transfer   atm cash withdrawal    when triggering the above sub exception type under main exception type should save below details.    date & time of the triggered.   transaction amount   transaction   exception type & sub type   severity level   location of the transaction (exception triggered).   user who access the system when triggering.   account number cause the triggering   chanel (branch/atm/online)   module   when the exception triggered should notify the users who mapped to “exception type” based on the selected notification type and severity level.    highest severity   alert mapped users immediately and send for approval if needed and include details in inquiry.   high/ medium severity   alert mapped users end of the day and send for approval if needed and include details in inquiry.   low severity   alert mapped users end of the day and include details in inquiry.   check:    verify exception and sub exception types:   ensure that the exception and sub exception types have been created correctly in the system.  confirm that the abex code is assigned to the account balance exception type.   confirm hardcoded exception sub codes:   check that the exception sub codes have been hardcoded in the backend as specified.   test exception triggering:   conduct thorough testing to ensure that exceptions are triggered correctly under the defined conditions.  verify that the correct exception sub codes are being generated.

description: do:     at the initiation stepper user should be able to see loan interest sections outstanding balance & same amount with balance to pay column.   and user can switch on/off two toggles as “percentage” & “interest rate”   if one toggle is enabled at the same time, the other toggle should be disabled   when turn on “interest rate” toggle, other one should disable to add inputs   according to input interest rate, balance to pay interest amount should be calculate with outstanding capital   by default, “percentage” toggle should turn on.   initially should load the outstanding balance as the balance to pay in loan interest record.   all the details should available as per before.   should be able to see the newly added loan interest rate option and the calculated values should replace the loan interest when turned on the toggle.   check:     relevant error messages should display.   should be saved successfully.

description: do;   # during all the teller operations in casa "deposit", "withdrawal", and "fund transfers", the api should send the "customer segment" tag in order to fetch the amount mapped to that customer tag in fee charge details definition. # an example api is provided below. in addition to the codes sent, the customer segment should also be included in these apis:  sl.fusionx.biz/casa product bca/calculations/cnwnb/sub product id/24446001/get charge?calculationfrequencycodes=fedp,fewd&chargebaseamount=5000 # wherever charges are being added, the customer segment should be included in the api call to fetch the amount mapped to that customer tag in fee charge details definition. # when no specific charge is assigned for the targeted customer segment, the api should verify the fee set for the 'all' customer segment and return it accordingly.   check;  # ensure that during teller operations such as "deposit", "withdrawal", and "fund transfers", the api includes the "customer segment" tag in its requests. # check that the provided example api includes the customer segment along with other parameters. # verify that the customer segment is correctly added to api calls wherever charges are being added. # test scenarios where specific charges are assigned for different customer segments and ensure that the api returns the correct amount based on the customer segment provided. # in cases where no specific charge is assigned for the targeted customer segment, ensure that the api correctly verifies the fee set for the 'all' customer segment and returns the amount accordingly. # confirm that the api responses contain the expected fee amounts based on the provided customer segment.

field.  internal  external     after selecting the posting method in debit interest details, posting type need to selected. posting type filed has two values in its’ lov. they are:  self  other     user able to config the account by clicking on the “config” button and if user add other’s account even selected posting type as “self”, the validation message should be fired as “this account does account, user should be able to select “ external ” as posting method.    after selecting “ external ” as posting method, user config the account and below filed to be filled to transfer the interest to external bank.   user able to click on “save” button and added details are saved.     check       user able to link the account to add their debit interest.   user able to add internal account or title: Enable Interest Modification in account level |Opening Account  (credit Interest Posting Details) -create
description: do      user able to link the account to add interest which customer will earn on their deposited funds by credit interest details section.    user able to add internal account or external account. therefore, following two methods to be added to posting method field.   internal   external   after selecting the posting method, posting type need to selected. posting type filed has two values in its’ lov. they are:   self   other     check     if user need to transfer their credit interest to an internal account which is belongs to account opening bank, user selects “internal” as posting method and user able to add customer’s own account or another person’s account.   if user need to transfer credit interest to customer’s own account, user able to select “self” as posting type.   user able to config the account by clicking on the “config” button and if user add another person’s account even selected posting type as “self”, the validation message should be fired as “this account does not belong to the current customer”.   if user select posting type as “other”, should not allow to select casa opening owner’s account.   if user need to transfer the credit interest to external account, user should be able to select “external” as posting method.   user able to add customer’s own account or another person’s account in external bank or financial institute.   if user need to transfer credit interest to customer’s own account in external bank, user selects “self” as posting type and if select “other” as posting type, interest is credited to selected account in external bank.   after selecting “external” as posting method, user config the account and below fields to be filled to transfer the interest to external bank.   bank/ finance institute   branch name   payment mode   payment send mode   account number   account type   account name   portion    user able to click on “save” button and added details are saved.

description: do   overdraft accounts within the casa module should be automatically  transferred to the recovery module. in this module, the following  transaction for overdraft accounts should be automatically blocked.    standing orders    scheduled payments    fund reservation    deposits    withdrawals    fund transfers  users should have the ability to unblock the permanently blocked  functions & temporarily blocked the mentioned functions that have  been transferred to the recovery module.     approval part    the following details of all the records related to the od recovery transaction block confirmation list should be displayed on this page. • account name • account number • action – block click the block action user should be navigating the blocking confirmation screen and all steps related to account creation should be shown here. a confirmation button and a previous button should be added in the last step. click the confirmation button user should be able to display a popup screen and ask “are you sure you want to block transactions this account?”. this popup screen has “confirmation” and “cancel” button. then user should be able to filled these fields. • status update   • note it should be possible to select the status update as "approve" or "reject" from a dropdown list and this is mandatory. the note should be able to enter in the text box.   check   in this module, when the overdraft accounts in the casa module are automatically transferred to the recovery module, the following is shown  check whether the transaction is automatically blocked for overdraft accounts.    standing order    scheduled payments    allocation of funds    deposits    withdrawals    fund transfers  users should be able to unblock permanently blocked and check if specified functions can be temporarily blocked.     approval part    in the od recovery transaction block confirmation list, check that the information of all relevant records is displayed correctly.   check all steps related to account creation in   check whether the status update can be selected as "approve or reject" with an lov   after filling the details correctly in the pop up screen and clicking on the confirm button, check that the respective blocks are verified successfully.

title: Account Module | Exception Handling | Transaction Exception Triggering  | Special Interest Rate (SRSI)
description: do:    hardcode exception sub codes in the backend:   implement the following exception sub codes in the backend (be):  main code   srex (special rate exceptions)  sub code:    srei    special interest rate   implement exception triggering:   refer to the exception triggering process flowchart for detailed steps.  trigger the appropriate exception with its sub code when the following conditions occur.    srei   if granted a special interest rate for an overdraft facility   grant permanent overdraft   grant temporary overdraft   casual overdraft    when triggering the above sub exception type under main exception type should save below details.    date & time of the triggered.   transaction amount   transaction   exception type & sub type   severity level   location of the transaction (exception triggered).   user who access the system when triggering.   account number cause the triggering   chanel (branch/atm/online)   module   when the exception triggered should notify the users who mapped to “exception type” based on the selected notification type and severity level.    highest severity   alert mapped users immediately and send for approval if needed and include details in inquiry.   high/ medium severity   alert mapped users end of the day and send for approval if needed and include details in inquiry.   low severity   alert mapped users end of the day and include details in inquiry.   check:    verify exception and sub exception types:   ensure that the exception and sub exception types have been created correctly in the system.  confirm that the srex code is assigned to the account balance exception type.   confirm hardcoded exception sub codes:   check that the exception sub codes have been hardcoded in the backend as specified.   test exception triggering:   conduct thorough testing to ensure that exceptions are triggered correctly under the defined conditions.  verify that the correct exception sub codes are being generated.

   currency mismatch   implement exception triggering:   refer to the exception triggering process flowchart for detailed steps.  trigger the appropriate exception with its sub code when the following conditions occur.    atcm    when trying to post a transaction involving different currencies, and there's a mismatch or unsupported currency pair for the account   counter cash withdrawal / deposit   cheque withdrawal / deposit   fund transfer   payment transaction (batch creation)   atm cash withdrawal    when triggering the above sub exception type under main exception type should save below details.    date & time of the triggered.   transaction amount   transaction   exception type & sub type   severity level   location of the transaction (exception triggered).   user who access the system when triggering.   account number cause the triggering   chanel (branch/atm/online)   module   when the exception triggered should notify the users who mapped to “exception type” based on the selected notification type and severity level.    highest severity   alert mapped users immediately and send for approval if needed and include details in inquiry.   high/ medium severity   alert mapped users end of the day and send for approval if needed and include details in inquiry.   low severity   alert mapped users end of the day and include details in inquiry.   check:    verify exception and sub exception types:   ensure that the exception and sub exception types have been created correctly in the system.  confirm that the atex code is assigned to the account balance exception type.   confirm hardcoded exception sub codes:   check that the exception sub codes have been hardcoded in the backend as specified.   test exception triggering:   conduct thorough testing to ensure that exceptions are triggered correctly under the defined conditions.  verify that the correct exception sub codes are being generated.

title: Account Module | Exception Handling | Transaction Exception Triggering  | Daily Transaction Limit Exceeded (ABDT)

the following conditions occur.    abdt    for security reasons if exceeds the daily transaction limits set for accounts, the transaction may be declined. in addition, the transaction should be recorded in the exception log.   counter cash withdrawal    cheque withdrawal    fund transfer   atm cash withdrawal    when triggering the above sub exception type under main exception type should title: Over draft recovery | Fee notification alert mapping (Address mapping) - Account |  Create / View / Update
description: create    do:     a new toggle will be added as “post”.   if the “post” toggle is enabled a new field will be viewed below named “postal address”.   if clicked on the field, a pop up screen will appear with the addresses that was mentioned during the customer onboarding process.8   if multiple address is there, user can only select one address from the action column.   after selection there will be a small cancel button, if that’s clicked the pop up should appear in order to select the address from the listed addresses.   the address field should be mandatory if the “post” toggle is enabled.   the “post” toggle can be edited during the “update” function in “manage account”.     check:     if the toggle is enabled and the address column is left empty, an error message should be viewed as “notification methods: please add address info for post notification method”. (this error message should be similar to the errors which are popped in the notification method selection screen)       view    do:   if the toggle was enabled during the creation phase the address details and the toggle status should be viewed in non editable forms during “activate account” in all “pending”, “rejected”, “special rate pending” and “special rate rejected” phases. also, during manage account > view inquiry>account inquiry in the “preference ” tab.   as well as in “manage account” block, deactivate, close, dormant, stop payment functions in the “preferences ”.   if the toggle was enabled during the creation phase the address details and the toggle status should be viewed in non editable forms during the “account confirmation list” in all confirmation section which are    deactivation confirmation list   blocking confirmation list   reactivation confirmation list   closing status update list   closing confirmation list   approve account   stop payment confirmation list   account dormant confirmation list   stop payment reversal confirmation list     check:     check if the user can not do any changes      update    do:     the “post” toggle can be edited during the “update” function in “manage account”.   if clicked on the field, a pop up screen will appear with the addresses that was mentioned during the customer onboarding process.   pop up screen name will be as “select postal address”.   if multiple address is there, user can only select one address from the action column.   after selection there will be a small cancel button, if that’s clicked the pop up should appear in order to select the address from the listed addresses.   the address field should be mandatory if the “post” toggle is enabled.   the user can disable the toggle if they wish to. if disabled the the field should disappear and should appear when enabled only.     check:     if the toggle is enabled and the address column is left empty, an error message should be viewed as “notification methods: please add address info for post notification method”. (this error message should be similar to the errors which are popped in the notification method selection screen)   check if the user can update this function in 'manage account' only

description: !image 20240306 055313.pngwidth=658,height=389!   important of bank guarantee?  types of bank guarantees are very often required in business. to mitigate the business risk of nonpayment of funds. ensure the continuity of business without disturbance. in case of nonpayment or default, the beneficiary has the right to claim the types of bank guarantee and continue the business. minimize the risk for each business parties fulfill the contact obligations under loan/contract agreement reduce the financial risk of business transactions in types of bank guarantee.  bank guarantee process/ how can i get a bank guarantee? / lg process  contract between seller and buyer and identified required bank guarantee contact the bank fill out the lg application specified the value of guarantee contract reference numbers are most important specified the purpose of guarantee name and address of the party validity dates are also very important additional conditions if any    !image 20240306 061339.png|width=50%!   types of bank guarantee   #  performance guarantees  #  financial guarantees  #  bid bond guarantees  #  advance payment guarantees  #  foreign bank guarantees  #  differed payment guarantees  #  warrantee guarantees  #  retention guarantees  #  personal guarantees  #  shipping guarantee

create     user logs into the system.   user navigates to the “settings” of “casa module”.   user clicks on “sub product” definition.   user will be navigated to the sub product definition ui.   user clicks on “create new”.   user enters the sub product details to create new sub product.   user enters the od details which is the 6th step in the sub product creation phase.   user selects the od template.   one toggle button should be added beneath the “od template” field.   toggle should be named as “apply recovery interest”. this should be an optional toggle.   this toggle should be added to the current account sub types only.   if “apply recover interest” toggle is enabled, another toggle and another field should appear beneath.   the appeared toggle name should be “apply penal interest”. this should be an optional toggle.   the appeared field should be named as “recovery stage”. this should be a mandatory field.   “recovery stage” field should be a dropdown field where the recovery stages will be listed.   if “apply recovery interest” is enabled recovery interest will be calculated up until the recovery stage that is selected by the user.   if the user has been agreed for a recovery method to pay back the od, the interest calculation should be stopped moving forward.   update     user clicks on “sub product” definition.   user will be navigated to the sub product definition ui.   user selects an existing record.   user clicks on “update record” in the action column for a particular record which needs an update.   user enters the sub product details to update a sub product.   user updates the od details which is the 6th step in the sub product creation phase.   user selects the od template.   one toggle button should be added beneath the “od template” field.   toggle should be named as “apply recovery interest”. this should be an optional toggle.   this toggle should be added to the current account sub types only.   if “apply recover interest” toggle is “recovery stage”. this should be a mandatory field.   “recovery stage” field should be a dropdown field where the recovery stages will be listed.   “apply recovery interest” is enabled recovery interest will be calculated up until the recovery stage that is selected by the user.   if the user has been agreed for a recovery method to pay back the od, the interest calculation should be stopped moving forward.     view     user logs into the system.   user navigates to the “settings” of “casa module”.   user clicks on “sub product” definition.   user will be navigated to the sub product definition ui.   user clicks on a record to view.   user navigates to the “od details” which is the 6th step in the sub product creation phase.   one toggle button should be viewed beneath the “od template” field.   toggle should be named as “apply recovery interest”. this should be an optional toggle.   this toggle should be viewed to the current account sub types only.   if “apply recover interest” toggle is enabled during the creation phase, another toggle and another field should be viewed beneath.   the other toggle name should be “apply penal interest”, which is an optional field.   the viewed field should be named as “recovery stage”, which is a mandatory field.   “recovery stage” field is a dropdown field where the recovery stages will be listed.   if the “apply recovery interest” toggle was enabled during the creation, the entered “recovery stage” details should be viewed in addition to the “apply penal interest “toggle.     check:       user should be able to view / title: Exception Handling | Transaction Exception Approval | Triggered exceptions Saving.
description: do     when triggering the above sub exception type under main exception type should save below details.  a.       date & time of the triggered.  b.      transaction amount  c.       transaction event  d.      exception type & sub type  e.       severity level  f.        location of the transaction (exception triggered). (login user branch)  g.      user who access the system when triggering.  h.      account number cause the triggering  i.        channel (branch/atm/online)   j.        module        when the exception triggered should entry log to above table        based on the severity level notify method should process below                 a.       highest severity:                                   alert mapped users immediately and send for approval if needed and include details in inquiry.                 b.      high/ medium severity:                                   alert mapped users end of the day and send for approval if needed and include details in inquiry.                 c.       low severity:                                   alert mapped users end of the day and include details in inquiry.     check     all triggering points should be insert to common table with mentioned priorities & relevant exceptions need to notify who mapped user with the type of exceptions.

description: do   in “ fraud detection exception ” type should implement  frae  code for trigger and it have below sub exception types   a.       operations in staff accounts (tdsa):   an exception should be generated when the user attempts to post and transaction in his own or relative’s account. this exception should be checked when deposit and withdrawal happens from the user’s own account or the relatives attached as nominee or guardian under his customer reference code. should be checked at the teller deposit and withdrawal transactions.   check     user attempts to post and transaction (deposit and withdrawal) in his own or relative’s (nominee or guardian) account.

title: Exception Handling | Transaction Exception Approval | System Exception
description: do   in “ system exception ” type should implement  syse  code for trigger and it have below sub exception types.   a.       technical glitches (tdtg):   an exception should be triggered when unforeseen technical issues like database errors, network failures, or software bugs that prevent transaction processing.   b.      third party service unavailability (tdtp):   an exception should be triggered for transactions that rely on third party services (e.g. external payment gateways), failures or unavailability of these services can cause exceptions.   c.       transaction timeout (tdtt):   an exception should be triggered for the transaction that took too long to process (more than 30 seconds)     check     database errors with exception triggering.   network failures with exception triggering.   software bugs with exception triggering.   third party services unavailability with exception triggering.   transaction that took too long to process with exception triggering.

title: Exception Handling | Transaction Exception Approval | Account Transaction Exception
description: do   in “ account transaction exception ” type should implement  trae  code for trigger and it have below sub exception types.              a.        duplicate transaction (tddt):   an exception should be triggered when the system detects that the same transaction has been initiated more than once within a short period (within one minute).  an exception should be raised when account pre mature, mature and manual renewal is created.               b.       backdated transaction (tdba):   an exception should be raised when a back dated transaction is done.  an exception should be raised when activating the account with the backdate yes option.     check     duplicate transaction triggered pre mature withdrawal with same account with in the define period.    duplicate transaction triggered mature withdrawal with same account with in the define period.   duplicate transaction triggered manual renewal is created with same account with in the define period.   backdated account activation with yes option

description: do:      user logs into the system using their credentials, then navigates to the casa module and then to the settings, under settings there is ‘transaction events’. where the following changes will be made.   new option should be added to the initial screen of the ‘transaction event’ as ‘view sub module status mapping’    user should be able to click the action, and then a pop up should be displayed, stating the sub module account status and the status of the account status (active or inactive) and then an update function to update the record.   if user want to create a new record, user can click on ‘create new’ option which will then open the create new pop up window.   then the user can choose the sub module, and the sub module status and can choose if the record stays active or inactive.   for these two lov, need to maintain sub module and module status table in the be as in the given example  statuslegal magistrate court|       once it is selected from the drop down, user can click on create to create a new record.   once created the screen navigates back to the initial setup   there is a validation from the back end check if the status type is mapped to the description: single    do:   when user clicks on the common settings module and move to “enable of tax certificate” option in the reports. user should be able to select the generate method as single or bulk.  if the user selects single printing users be able to print tax certificate for a selected customer for a selected tax code.  tax code be able to get from common settings >tax code definition   tax code at the drop down should display as below,  (tax code   tax name)                  ex:                                       ccrt credit tax  click on “ print ” button user should be able to print a single customer report   check:   check the print is happened with the related data  user should only be able to print tax certificate for a single tax code  check the search   check the related error messages     bulk    do:   when user clicks on the common settings module and move to “enable of tax certificate” option in the settings. user should be able to select the generate method as single or bulk.  if the user selects bulk printing users be able to print tax certificate for all the customers in a selected period for a selected tax code.  for the bulk generate method users be able to search through below parameters,  ·         tax code  ·         module   ·         from    ·         to    tax code be able to get from common settings >tax code definition  at the drop down tax code should display as below,  (tax code   tax name)                  ex:                                       ccrt credit tax  click on “ print ” button user should be able to print reports as bulk     check:   check the print is happened with the related data  user should only be able to print tax certificate for a single tax code  check the search data related for the search parameters  check the related error messages

Lead Creation | Option to abandon the Process before submit (Back Button)Finalize Technical Design
Lead Creation | Option to abandon the Process before submit | Cancellation (Reject / Approval )
description: lead cancel (approve / reject )     do:      user navigates to the origination dashboard from the lending module and then click on the ‘approval pending’ tab.   where the user can see the record in the grid has the ‘request status’ changed as “lead cancel”.   user can select the record and then there’s a pop up view of the created lead and then the user can select the two options, ‘approve’ or ‘reject’    in here the ‘approve’ options refers to cancel the record, once the record is cancelled it should be removed from the ‘in progress’ tab.   in here the ‘reject’ option refers to cancel the process, which means that the cancel request is rejected, once it is rejected the record should return to the ‘in progress’ tab and should have the request statuses as ‘approved’.    check:      check if the user can select the ‘approval pending' tab and see if there is any records as the status changed to 'lead cancel’   check if the user can click on this record and approve or reject    check if the lead is reject the status of the lead changes to it’s previous stage (approved status before the lead cancel) and should return to the in progress tab    check if the lead is approved the lead should be removed from the ‘in progress' tab and the status should remain as 'lead cancel’

title: Special Rate Approval | Enable Workflow (Different Levels) | Special Rate Approval – BE dev
description: do:   user should be able to map the user groups for special rate approval.  user be able to map user groups and rate or amount ranges through below parameters.  ·         workflow type – special rate (can define based on the module)  ·         method – rate/ amount  ·         user group  ·         rate/amount – from/ to  user should be able to selects method as rate or amount.  user group is a drop down value. values for the drop down should be taken from the active user groups defined in the authorization module (for a one user group there should only be a one rate or amount range).  common (api)service should create should create a flag for modules should use the common api for the every screens      scenario 1   selects method as rate   if the method selects as “rate” user should be able to add the rate range for the selected user group.  for a one user group there should only be a one rate range.  should not be able to add multiple rate ranges for a one user group.  rate ranges can be as below example,  branch manager 1%   5%  area manager      1%   10%      scenario 2   selects method as amount   if the method selects as “amount” user should be able to add the amount range for the selected user group.  for a one user group there should only be a one amount range.  should not be able to add multiple amount ranges for a one user group.  amount ranges can be as below example,  branch manager 1,000.00 – 100,000.00  area manager      1,000.00 – 1,000.000.00  the details must be displayed according to the added criteria.  “remove” action should be there to remove added user groups  “ save ” button should be there to submit the added details. the user should get a confirmation message as “are you sure you want to save the special rate approval?”  “ reset ” button should be there to reset all the added details  “ back ” button should be there to go back to the previous page         note   based on the respective module, when triggering the special rate approval this definition should check. and should be able to approve according to the user group  eg:  module – td  workflow type – special rate  method – rate   ,"content":[,"content":[]}]}]},,"content":[]}]}]}]},,"content":[]}]}]},,"content":[]}]}]}]},,"content":[]}]}]},,"content":[]}]}]},,"content":[]}]}]}]},,"content":[]}]}]},,"content":[]}]}]},,"content":[]}]}]}]}]}      user added a special rate when creating the account as 2.5%.  this account should be visible to the users who are defined under “regional manager” user group in the authorization module.  cannot see this account in the special rate pending tab if you are a branch manger  approval process is same as existing. only the privilege is checked with this definition     check:   check when a special rate submitted for approval, approval request should load to the related user groups  check the user groups mapped properly with the rate ranges or amount ranges.

title: Common Module | Exception Handling | Exception Type and Sub Type Definition | Permission Mapping
Common Module | Exception Handling | Exception Type and Sub Type Definition | Exception Sub Type and Notification user group Mapping
description: do     go to exception sub type master in the common settings module   click on “view notification user type”   once clicking on “view notification user group” a pop up should open with following details. already created mappings should be displayed   notification user/ group   user / user group name   status   update record button        check    create new     there should be a create new option to add new mappings   in the create option user should be able to select followings,   notification user/ group – should be a drop down value. in the drop down need to display “user” or “user group”   user/ user group name –   if selected “notification user/ group” is  user  need to load the active users created in the authorization module. should be displayed in a drop down to select. mandatory field. auto fill option should be enabled   if selected “notification user/ group” is  user group  need to load the active designations created in the authorization module. active designations should be displayed in a drop down to select. mandatory field       status   in the creation, default status should be displayed as active   create button – should be there to add the mapping   back button – should be there to navigate to mapping view pop up   if there are already created active mappings for same user group should not be able to add another. fire a validation as “user group already mapped”      update record      once  clicking on the update record button, the selected details should be displayed in the pop up.   only the status can be updated.   update button should be there to update the mapping   back button should be there to navigate to mapping view pop up      user group mapping should save against “exception sub type”   user should have permissions   there should be existing exception sub types to add user group mappings   if there are already created active mappings for same user group should not be able to add another. fire a validation as “user group already mapped”   mandatory fields cannot be blank.   created & modified user/date/time should save automatically.

title: Common Module | Exception Handling | Exception Type and Sub Type Definition | Exception Sub Type Update
description: do     go to exception sub type master   click on update record which need to update   do the update as required   click on update     check     . once loading the page, i should be able to view following details   module   exception type name   exception sub type code   exception sub type name   exception sub type description   severity level   approval required   notification method – view pop up   status   except sub type code, all the details can be updated.    can “inactive”/ “active” an exception sub type by disabling/ enabling the status toggle.   update button should be there to save all the changes. by selecting the “ update ” button; the user gets a confirmation message as “are you sure you want to update existing exception sub type?”   there should be two options in the confirmation message “ok” and “cancel”   if i click on “ok”, i should receive a successful message “exception sub type successfully updated”   if the update is not successful due to any technical error, i should receive an unsuccessful message as “exception sub type update unsuccessful”   if i click on “cancel”, i should stay in the update page.   “ back ” button should be there to clear all the details and navigate to exception sub type inquiry page.   “ reset ” button should be there to reset the changes done and display the last saved details.   user should have permissions to update   there should be existing exception sub types to update   after clicking the update button without entering mandatory details user unable to save it and system should pop up required message under the field. message “please enter a value”   mandatory fields cannot be blank   modified user/date/time should save automatically.

title: Lead Creation | Option to abandon the Process before submit (Back Button) | Lead cancel
description: back button    do:      the back button is there inside the ‘new lead’, user can click on the back button if the user wishes to navigate to the origination dashboard with the ‘in progress’ tab selected.   the back button is also located in the update lead page, where again the user can click on the back button if the user wishes to navigate to the origination dashboard with the ‘in progress’ tab selected.    check:    check if the back button navigates the user to the origination dashboard with the 'in progress' tab .      lead cancel     do:    user logs into the system and navigates to the origination dashboard in the lending module.   user should click on the ‘in progress’ tab and then select a record from the tab.   the user can also cancel a lead once it is approved for the appraisal, and also if the created lead is in ‘pending’ status.   once cancelled the record the status will be shown as ‘lead cancel’ and then the record should be removed from the in progress tab.   if the record status is in ‘approved’ the user can select the record and cancel it, but the record goes to a cancel request in the ‘approval pending’ screen.   once the record is sent for cancellation request that same record should be shown in the ‘in progress’ tab with the request status changed to ‘lead cancel’.    check:      check if the user can log into the system , if entered correct credentials user should be able to enter the system    check if the user can select a lead in the 'in progress' tab    check if the user can click on the cancel button inside the lead, if can the lead must have the request status as 'lead cancel' and should disappear from the in progress tab   check if the record goes to 'cancel pending' status when clicked on cancel lead    check if the particular lead in the in progress bar has the status as 'lead cancel'

title: Exception Handling | Transaction Exception Approval | FE DEV
description: do  # user login into the system and selects the “branch vault fund operations” option. # in the option, user have to select the “transaction exception approval” feature.  check  # after the successful login, user should be able to search existing transaction exception pending records through the following search parameters,    transaction date   transaction reference code   exception type code   2. according to the successful search the following details should be displayed to the user,    transaction date   transaction reference code   transaction   exception type code   exception sub type code   action (select)  3. by choosing the “select” action, user should be navigating to the “transaction exception approval” screen.  4.in the screen the following fields should be displayed to the user,    transaction date   transaction reference code   transaction   exception type code   exception type   exception sub type code    exception sub type    severity    created user   created date & time  5. after viewing the details user have to select the data for the “confirmation” field as “approve” / “reject” / “escalate”.  6. if the data for the “confirmation” field selected as “escalate”, then a pop up should be displayed to the user in order to select a particular higher level employee.  7. after choosing the data for the “confirmation” field, by choosing the confirm button at the end of the page then a validation message should display as “are you sure you want to do the transaction exception approval?”  a. confirm: pending transaction exception approval record will be approved  escalated.  b. cancel: process will be declined.  8. user should be able to accept/reject/escalate exceptional transaction  9. approved user/date/time should be recorded.

title: Special Rate Approval | Enable Workflow (Different Levels) | Special Rate Approval – CASA Module
description: do:    casa module  > settings  > credit interest  > special rate approval     user should be able to map the user groups for special rate approval.  user be able to map user groups and rate or amount ranges through below parameters.  ·         workflow type – special rate (can define based on the module)  ·         method – rate/ amount  ·         user group  ·         rate/amount – from/ to  user should be able to selects method as rate or amount.  user group is a drop down value. values for the drop down should be taken from the active user groups defined in the authorization module (for a one user group there should only be a one rate or amount range).      scenario 1   selects method as rate   if the method selects as “rate” user should be able to add the rate range for the selected user group.  for a one user group there should only be a one rate range.  should not be able to add multiple rate ranges for a one user group.  rate ranges can be as below example,  branch manager 1%   5%  area manager      1%   10%      scenario 2   selects method as amount   if the method selects as “amount” user should be able to add the amount range for the selected user group.  for a one user group there should only be a one amount range.  should not be able to add multiple amount ranges for a one user group.  amount ranges can be as below example,  branch manager 1,000.00 – 100,000.00  area manager      1,000.00 – 1,000.000.00  for the casa module should add a mandatory drop down to select account type.  the details must be displayed according to the added criteria.  “remove” action should be there to remove added user groups  “ save ” button should be there to submit the added details. the user should get a confirmation message as “are you sure you want to save the special rate approval?”  “ reset ” button should be there to reset all the added details  “ back ” button should be there to go back to the previous page     note   based on the respective module, when triggering the special rate approval this definition should check. and should be able to approve according to the user group  eg:  module – casa  workflow type – special rate  method – rate   ,"content":[,"content":[]}]}]},,"content":[]}]}]}]},,"content":[]}]}]},,"content":[]}]}]}]},,"content":[]}]}]},,"content":[]}]}]},,"content":[]}]}]}]},,"content":[]}]}]},,"content":[]}]}]},,"content":[]}]}]}]}]}      user added a special rate when creating the account as 2.5%.  this account should be visible to the users who are defined under “regional manager” user group in the authorization module.  cannot see this account in the special rate pending tab if you are a branch manger  approval process is same as existing. only the privilege is checked with this definition     check:   check when a special rate submitted for approval, approval request should load to the related user groups  check the user groups mapped properly with the rate ranges or amount ranges.

title: Transaction Reference & Statement Reference | New UI Development | View Page
description: do     view page  in the settings user have to select the "transaction reference & statement reference" option , user should be able to search existing records through the following search parameters,    transaction sub code   statement reference description   status   create page  in the settings user have to select the "transaction reference & statement reference" option , user should be able to search existing records through the following search parameters,    transaction sub code   statement reference description   status  according to the successful search the following fields should be displayed to the user,    transaction sub code   statement reference description   status   action (view  update record)   update page  by choosing the “update” option in the specific record, user should be navigate to the update screen of the selected record. in the update screen, user should be able to update the following fields,    transaction code – lov    transaction sub code – lov     statement reference description   text box     status   active/inactive    after providing the data for mandatory fields by selecting the “confirm” button, user will get the confirmation message as “are you sure you want to update existing record?” confirm : existing record will be updated. cancel : record will not be updated.  should be display the response messages.    check     view page  check if the following details should be loaded according to the successful search,    transaction sub code   statement reference description   status   create page   check if the following details should be loaded according to the successful search,    transaction sub code   statement reference description   status   action (view | update record)   update page    check if, by choosing the “update” option in the specific record, user should be navigate to the update screen of the selected record. in the update screen, user should be able to update the following fields,    transaction code – lov    transaction sub code – lov     statement reference description   text box     status   active/inactive    after providing data for mandatory fields by selecting "confirm". button, the user will get the confirmation message “are you sure you want to”. update existing record?" confirm: check if the existing record will be updated. cancel: check if the record is not updated.  check if should be display the relevant response messages.
