description: do:   other eligibility code should mapped from casa and  if there not any recovery account mapped to the current account should give a notice to the teller. “recovery account is not mapped”     check:   check if the error message occur when any recovery account is not mapped

title: Over draft recovery | Define feature and benefit eligibility | CASA Module Development
description: do:   user should be able to map other eligibility for below scenario.  at od settlement process when people pay excess amounts with the emis (equated monthly instalment) users should be able to decide to hold that amount or to transfer that amount to a linked recovery account that created for the customer.  the excess amount transfer should occur regarding to this other eligibility type code,   orec   od recovery enable casual excess.   if the above code is mapped to the other eligibility and turned on below process should occur,  if allowed or the status is turned on. the excess amount should transfer to the mapped recovery account.  if status is not active or turned off, the excess amount should remain at the current account.  should create the other eligibility with the code to map.  if the user provides unrelated data for fields, then related error messages should occur.     check:   check if the other eligibility code be able to  map properly.  check if the other eligibility code mapped and process be process runs properly.

title: Common Module | Enable of Tax Certificate | Bulk
description: do:   when user clicks on the common settings module and move to “enable of tax certificate” option in the settings. user should be able to select the generate method as single or bulk.  if the user selects bulk printing users be able to print tax certificate for all the customers in a selected period for a selected tax code.  for the bulk generate method users be able to search through below parameters,  ·         tax code  ·         module   ·         from    ·         to    tax code be able to get from common settings >tax code definition  at the drop down tax code should display as below,  (tax code   tax name)                  ex:                                       ccrt credit tax  after search for the related tax code users be able to see the details under below parameters.  ·         customer identification number  ·         customer name  ·         account number  ·         tax number  ·         product  ·         sub product  ·         tax code  ·         tax applicable amount  ·         tax percentage  ·         date  ·         tax amount  ·         action   view  ·         select  users be able to select one or more records or select all records. and print bulk  should print group wise to the customer  a pop up should available to see the customer related taxes. the parameters are,  ·         account number  ·         tax number  ·         product  ·         sub product  ·         tax code  ·         tax applicable amount  ·         tax percentage  ·         date  ·         tax amount  the above details must be displayed according to the search criteria.  “ search ” button to search “reset” button should be there to reset the added details     check:   check the print is happened with the related data  user should only be able to print tax certificate for a single tax code  check the search data related for the search parameters  check the related error messages

title: Common Module | Enable of Tax Certificate | Single
description: do:   when user clicks on the common settings module and move to “enable of tax certificate” option in the reports. user should be able to select the generate method as single or bulk.  if the user selects single printing users be able to print tax certificate for a selected customer for a selected tax code.  for the single generate method users be able to search through below parameters,  ·         customer  ·         tax code  ·         module   ·         from    ·         to    tax code be able to get from common settings >tax code definition   tax code at the drop down should display as below,  (tax code   tax name)                  ex:                                       ccrt credit tax     when user click on the customer field a pop up should appear to search a customer. the search parameters at the select customer pop up are,  ·         customer name  ·         customer reference code  ·         account number  table parameters are,  ·         customer name  ·         customer code  ·         account number  ·         product  ·         action   select  after search for the customer related tax code, users be able to see the details under below parameters.  ·          customer name   ·          reference code   ·          identification number   ·         account number  ·         tax number  ·         product  ·         sub product  ·         tax code  ·         tax applicable amount  ·         tax percentage  ·         date  ·         tax amount  the above details must be displayed according to the search criteria.  “ search ” button to search “ reset ” button should be there to reset the added details.  if the user provides unrelated or non existing data for selected search parameters, then details will not display and message to be display as “ no data ”.  existing data should be displayed.     check:   check the print is happened with the related data  user should only be able to print tax certificate for a single tax code  check the search   check the related error messages

title: Kenya | Live | TD Reports and Shedulers Add Hoc Testing
All Module | Common Loading Page | Common Settings
description: do  # identify the existing function responsible for displaying the loading page in all modules.    fusionx loading page   module loading page   dashboard loading     2. before making any changes, create a backup of the existing code or commit the current state to version control. this ensures you can revert if needed.    3. within the identified function, look for the code that displays the image during loading. remove or comment out the lines of code related to the image display.    4. replace the removed image code with code that displays a gif instead. ensure the gif file is accessible and properly referenced in the code.   5. test the modified loading function locally within one module to ensure that the gif is displayed correctly during loading.  6. if the local test is successful, replicate the changes to the loading function across all modules where it is used. ensure consistency in implementation.  check  # manually inspect the code to confirm that the lines related to image display have been removed or commented out. ensure there are no references to the removed image. # check that the code now includes the necessary lines to display the gif during loading. confirm that the gif file is properly referenced, and the path is correct. # test the loading page with the modified function across different web browsers to ensure compatibility. verify that the gif displays consistently without any issues. # test the modified loading function in each module to ensure that the changes have been successfully applied universally. confirm that the gif displays in place of the removed image in all modules. # assess the performance impact of the gif compared to the image. ensure that the loading time remains acceptable and that the gif does not cause any noticeable slowdowns. # if possible, gather feedback from users to ensure that the modified loading page is visually appealing and effectively communicates the loading process.

title: New Interest Calculations (Compound Interest) | UI Dev
description: do   by using the compound interest type, the relevant interest amount should be automatically calculated and displayed correctly for each day.  a = p (1+ r/n) ^ nt  p > the capital of the invested amount r > the annual interest rate in decimal form. n > the number of times that interest is compounded per unit. t > the time the money is invested for, in years. a > total benefit at the end of the period  each active account should show the total invest amount (including interest) as on the relevant date. in the account creation & update if the selected sub product’s interest calculation method is itco (compound) the benefit calculation should happen based on the above mentioned calculation. the interest calculation schedule and application schedule should work based on the above calculation if the method is compound.   check     for active term deposit accounts, the compound interest calculation method should calculate the interest correctly and check that the total deposit amount for the date is correctly displayed.

title: All Module (CASA & TD) | Abandoned Property Management | Property transfer creation
description: do    1.1.1.1.        based on the core product dormant parameters system should run the daily schedule.   1.1.1.2.  those captured accounts should be displayed in this option grid.   1.1.1.3.       based on the business requirement user should be able to select the casa/td account   1.1.1.4.       after selecting the required account user needs to process those. this option is available page wise.   1.1.1.5.       after clicking the process button user will redirected to a popup screen in which the user has to select the central bank and he/she can see the transfer amount currency wise.   1.1.1.6.       have to select when this transfer happened to date.    1.1.1.7.       after confirm this it will transfer for confirmation workflow.   1.1.1.8.       before confirming this transfer, the status should be pending.    check   01 transaction created successfully   02. account status need to update

title: Exception Handling | Transaction Exception Triggering  | Fraud Detection Exception - Operations in Staff Account - Inward Clearance, Cheque Transaction
description: do:    hardcode exception sub codes in the backend:   implement the following exception sub codes in the backend (be):  main code   frex (fraud detection exception)  sub codes:    operations in staff accounts   frsa   implement exception triggering:   refer to the exception triggering process flowchart for detailed steps.  trigger the appropriate exception with its sub code when the following conditions occur.    frsa   should be generated when the user attempts to post and transaction in his own or relative’s account.    should check in below transactions   inward clearance     batch creates   batch update   batch validation   batch exception processing   cheque transaction     received cheques deposit   cheques deposit realization    when triggering the above sub exception type under main exception type should save below details.    date & time of the triggered.   transaction amount   transaction   exception type & sub type   severity level   location of the transaction (exception triggered).   user who access the system when triggering.   account number cause the triggering   chanel (branch/atm/online)   module   when the exception triggered should notify the users who mapped to “exception type” based on the selected notification type and severity level.    highest severity   alert mapped users immediately and send for approval if needed and include details in inquiry.   high/ medium severity   alert mapped users end of the day and send for approval if needed and include details in inquiry.   low severity   alert mapped users end of the day and include details in inquiry.   check:    verify exception and sub exception types:   ensure that the exception and sub exception types have been created correctly in the system.  confirm that the frex code is assigned to the fraud detection exception type.   confirm hardcoded exception sub codes:   check that the exception sub codes have been hardcoded in the backend as specified.   test exception triggering:   conduct thorough testing to ensure that exceptions are triggered correctly under the defined conditions.  verify that the correct exception sub codes are being generated.

description: (need to add a new step in the td opening account as “loan request details” between the “me & business introducer” step and “collection details” step)   after completing the initial steps (no change to the existing process),  once the user comes to the “loan interest details” page there should be a tick box named as “loan required”. this should be an optional field.  if the user clicks on the tick box the below fields should appear.  loan main product  loan sub product  td credit interest rate  td special rate  special rate status  loan interest margin    loan interest rate  check loan exposure (button)  eligibility loan amount  loan amount    the loan main product and the loan sub product of the specific td sub product (which was added during the td sub product creation phase) should appear in the loan main product and loan sub product fields. these should be display fields only.  to get the td interest rate, user should select the sub product and payment type (account detail step), based on the details retrieved credit interest rate should be visible in the “td credit interest rate” field. this should be a display field. (should update details between steps, if any changes done going back to steps)  when the user enters details in the “interest details” step, there is a filed named as “special rate” which is an optional field. if the user has entered any value in that field in interest details, it should be visible in the “td special rate” field in “loan request details”. this should be a display field. (should update details between steps, if any changes done going back to steps)  if the special rate was entered during the creation phase and is not yet being sent for approval the special rate status should mention “created” status. after approval it should be changed to “approved” status. this should be a display field.  the “loan interest margin” will be entered by the user. this should be a mandatory field. should allow up to two decimals.  according to the entered loan interest margin the loan interest rate will be calculated. this field will be display only field.  loan interest rate = (td interest rate  special rate  (can be in created /approved status)   loan interest margin rate)  the “check loan exposure” is a button, once clicked on it an api call should be generated in order to check the collateral loan exposure limit percentage which is defined in the collateral module settings.  the api call should have the below details in them  ·        td main product  ·        td sub product  ·        td account generation date  ·        interest payment type  ·        renewal type  these details should be checked with the values created in collateral loan exposure, and the loan exposure percentage should be identified,  after identification a calculation should be run as following  loan exposure percentage = x  amount = amount mentioned in account details during td account generation   eligible loan amount =   x   /100  amount   the calculated value amount should be visible in the “eligible loan amount” field.  until eligible loan amount calculated, loan amount field should be in disable mode.  user can enter an amount in the “loan amount” field, more importantly the user should be prevented to enter an amount more than the eligible loan amount. this should be a mandatory field.  just like the rest of the screens there should be 3 buttons at the end of the page as “save draft”, “previous” and “next”.  if clicked on “save draft” the record should be saved in drafts.

description: do   create     these details should be added in a new step   new step to be added as the last step “related loan product details"     user clicks on “create new” in “sub product” ui.   user be navigated to general sub product details creation page.   user then selects the finals step which is “related loan product details”   a toggle will be present as “allow cash backed loan”   if the toggle is enabled 3 new fields should appear named as “loan main product”, “loan sub product” and “loan activation”.   all 3 fields are mandatory if the toggle is enabled.   therefore, asterisks should be there in all 3 fields.    “loan main product” field should be a drop down field. the drop down values should be grabbed from the  active  main products in the lending module.   lending > settings > main products> active    “loan sub product” field should be a drop down field. the drop down values should be grabbed from the  active  sub products of the selected main product in the lending module which has the feature benefit item as cash backed loan mapped to the sub products.   lending > settings > sub products (which belong to the above selected main product)> active (sub products which has the cash backed loan feature benefit mapped to it).    “loan activation” field should be a drop down field. the drop down values should be as “auto approval with td activation” and “lead creation only”. (this will be explained in a separate story)  as the existing flow the user should be able to save the sub product with the entered details.  no changes in the rest of the sub product page, it should remain as it is.       view    these details should be added in a new step   new step to be added as the last step “related loan product details"      user searches for a sub product using the existing search parameters.    once the search results appear, user clicks on the “view record” link.   user be navigated to general sub product details view page.    user then selects the finals step which is “related loan product details”   a toggle will be present as “allow cash backed loan”   only if the toggle was enabled by the user during the creation phase, 3 fields should be visible beneath the toggle.   which are the “loan main product”, “loan sub product” and “loan activation”. these should have the asterisk marks indicating they are mandatory fields.    user should be able to Lending Module |Charges | Charges Refunds | Create - FE
description: do     user should be able to click on “charges refund”, on transaction management in lending module.   if user select the “charges refund”, option it will navigate to “charges refund” page.   user able to search the refund charges request by following search parameters. ·  account number ·  customer name   after search the changes refund requests, searched data will load in a with following columns.   if user need to create charge refund, user able to click on “create new” button.   user able to search loan accounts, by below search parameters.  ·        sub product  ·        branch  ·        account status  ·        account number  ·        customer name  ·        identification number    after loading the loan accounts in the grid, user able to select loan account, and multiple accounts can’t be selected.    user able to add charges need to refund to selected loan account.   under the selected loan account number will be displayed following column  a.     charge type  b.     charge category  c.     debited amount  d.     collected debit amount  e.      paid amount (3rd party)  f.      already refund amount  g.     available to refund amount (d  e  f = g)  h.     refund amount    charge type will be displayed as “insurance charge”, “document charges” & etc.   fee category will be displayed which created in fee type definition.   selected loan account records should be loaded which available refundable charge greater than or equal 0.   after loading the multiple records, user able to select records to refund by adding tick on the check box.   sum of the amount of the selected records  should be get and that amount able to refund.   refund amount column should be editable.   user able to select the payee name.   user should be able to select payment method.  ·        if payment method is  cash , should be enable to select the payment currency.  ·        if the default payment method is  “cheque” , following fields to be enabled.  bank account – bank account should be able to select which is created in the “bank account” master. created bank account name should be displayed with the account number.  the cheque print should happen from this selected disbursement account  bank   the bank should be displayed as per the selected account  branch– the branch of the bank should be displayed as per the selected account  ·        if the default payment method is  “bank transfer”,  following fields to be enabled.    disbursement bank account – bank account should be able to select which is created in the “bank account” master. the created bank account name should be displayed with the account number.   the bank transfer (supplier payment) will initiate from this selected disbursement account.   bank   the bank should be displayed as per the selected account   branch   the branch of the bank should be displayed as per the selected account.   remit it – to account – the payee’s bank account entered in the supplier side should be displayed.   remit to  bank name – the bank should be displayed as per the selected remit to account.   remit  to  branch  the branch of the bank should be displayed as per the selected remit to account.       if not added the payees, customer name should be displayed as payee.   after creating the charges refund it will be recorded in payment module.    “ submit ” button is there to confirm the creation of refund charge request. by clicking the “ submit ” button; the user gets a confirmation message as “refund charge request is successfully created”.    “back ” button navigates to previous page.     “ reset ” button navigates to clear the added details.   check     user should be able to click on “charges refund”, on transaction management in lending module.   if user select description: initiation  do  # user should be able to login into the system and selects the “lending” module option. # in that user should be able to choose the “transaction management” option, and selects “contract transfer” option. # in the forum user should be able to search existing contract transfer requests through the following search parameters,    batch number   status   to branch  4. according to the successful search the following details will be displayed to the user,    batch number   request status   to branch   action (view | cancel)   5. by choosing the view action, a pop up should displayed to the user.   6. by selecting the “create new” button, use navigates to the create new forum.  check  # in the create new forum, user should be able to search loan accounts through the following search criteria,    account number   product   marketing executive   branch   2. “select marketing executive” button should generate a pop up, where the user should be able to select  a marketing executive through that.  3. by choosing the “search” button, user should be able to search the relevant loan accounts.  4. according to the successful search the following details of the loan accounts will be displayed to the user,    account number   product code   facility amount   contract outstanding   current branch  5. user should be able to mark the loan accounts through the check box.  6. after marking in the check box, by choosing the “add to batch” button, “batch details” will be displayed to the user.  (selected accounts will be added into a batch)  7. in the “batch details”, the following details will be displayed to the user,    account number   product name   sub product name   facility amount   contract outstandings  8. by marking in the check box, selected loan accounts will be created as a batch inorder to do the contract transfer process.  9. data for “branch” should be selected from the drop down list and “comment” should be a text box, “marketing executive” should be selected from the drop down list as well.  10. “print” button should allow the user to print the receipt.  11. by choosing the “save” button contract transfer request will be initiated and successful message should be displayed as “record for batch 121212 was successfully created”.  authorization  do  # after initiating the request, the status of the request will be displayed as “pending”. # by choosing the particular request, user should be able to view the request user and mark it as “confirm” or “reject”. (created user cannot confirm the request)  check  # if it’s selected as “confirm”, then branch for the selected loan accounts should be moved. # after confirming the request, through “branch transfer scheduler”, selected requests will be transferred to the other branch.  (ensure branch transfer scheduler runs according to the defined date & time, it can be verified by checking the “process schedule setup” table in the lending database)

title: Lending Module | Tax Code Definition | Create & Update Tax Code Definition - FE_QA
description: do;   create    as the system administrator once i click into the page, i need to view the existing “tax code definitions – lending” values which are already created and their status.  a.       code  b.       name  c.        description  d.       tax category  e.       transaction code  f.        transaction sub code  g.       active/ inactive statues    on the top right hand corner in the existing list there should be a button named “create new”. once i click that button i want to be directed to a new modal to enter the details of the new tax code.  a.       code  b.       name  c.        description  d.       tax category  e.       transaction code  f.        transaction sub code  g.       active/ inactive statues    update    as the system administrator once i click into the page, i need to view the existing “tax code definitions – lending” values which are already created and their status.  a.       code  b.       name  c.        description  d.       tax category  e.       transaction code  f.        transaction sub code  g.       active/ inactive statues     in front of each existing recode there should be a button named “update”. once i click the relevant update button i want to be directed to a new modal to enter the changes in the details of the “tax code definition lending”.     check;   user should be able to view the already created existing “tax code definitions – lending” values  check if the user can click on “create new”.  once  clicked on that button user should be directed to a new modal to enter the details of the new tax code  after completing all required data, i click on save button and i should get a message asking “are you sure, you want to create a tax code? ”.    there should be two options in the confirmation message “ok” and “cancel”   if i click on “ok”, i should receive a successful message “new tax code successfully created”   if not saved successfully, i should receive an unsuccessful message “sorry ! , new tax code creation unsuccessful, try again ”   if i click on “cancel”, the pop up message screen should be cancelled and stay in the confirmation details screen    after editing required data, i should be able to click on “update button” and once i press the update button. i need to get a message asking “are you sure, you want to update the tax code? ”.    there should be two options in the confirmation message “ok” and “cancel”   if i click on “ok”, i should receive a successful message “tax code successfully updated”    if not saved successfully, i should receive an unsuccessful message “sorry ! ,  tax code update unsuccessful, try again ”    if i click on “cancel”, the pop up message screen should be cancelled and stay in the confirmation details screen

description: do:    the interest rates for permanent and temporary overdraft facilities, recorded at the overdraft facility request level during the overdraft approval, same interest rate should be utilize at the overdraft interest calculation process.    if there are more than one (multiple ) active od facilities in an account, for interest calculation the prioritizing for interest rates should be taken from lowest interest facility.    example : if the account od balance 550,000.00   int rate  18% 13.5% 14 % 28%  od interest calculation   pod 1   200,000.00   13.5%  pod 1   100,000.00   14%  tod 1  100,000.00   18%  cod 1   150,0000   28%    check:    check whether the saved interest rate at tod / pod granting is utilized for interest calculation.

title: New Interest Calculations (Compound Interest) | BE Development
description: do   by using the compound interest type, the relevant interest amount should be automatically calculated and displayed correctly for each day.  a = p (1+ r/n) ^ nt  p > the capital of the invested amount r > the annual interest rate in decimal form. n > the number of times that interest is compounded per unit. t > the time the money is invested for, in years. a > total benefit at the end of the period  each active account should show the total invest amount (including interest) as on the relevant date. in the account creation & update if the selected sub product’s interest calculation method is itco (compound) the benefit calculation should happen based on the above mentioned calculation. the interest calculation schedule and application schedule should work based on the above calculation if the method is compound.   check    for active term deposit accounts, the compound interest calculation method should calculate the interest correctly and check that the total deposit amount for the date is correctly displayed.

description: do  # identify the existing function responsible for displaying the loading page in all modules.     fusionx loading page   module loading page   dashboard loading    2. before making any changes, create a backup of the existing code or commit the current state to version control. this ensures you can revert if needed.    3. within the identified function, look for the code that displays the image during loading. remove or comment out the lines of code related to the image display.    4. replace the removed image code with code that displays a gif instead. ensure the gif file is accessible and properly referenced in the code.    5. test the modified loading function locally within one module to ensure that the gif is displayed correctly during loading.   6. if the local test is successful, replicate the changes to the loading function across all modules where it is used. ensure consistency in implementation.  check  # manually inspect the code to confirm that the lines related to image display have been removed or commented out. ensure there are no references to the removed image. # check that the code now includes the necessary lines to display the gif during loading. confirm that the gif file is properly referenced, and the path is correct. # test the loading page with the modified function across different web browsers to ensure compatibility. verify that the gif displays consistently without any issues. # test the modified loading function in each module to ensure that the changes have been successfully applied universally. confirm that the gif displays in place of the removed image in all modules. # assess the performance impact of the gif compared to the image. ensure that the loading time remains acceptable and that the gif does not cause any noticeable slowdowns. # if possible, gather feedback from users to ensure that the modified loading page is visually appealing and effectively communicates the loading process.

title: Common Module | Balance Confirmation Letter | Request & Generate Balance Confirmation Letter
description: do  # in the request forum user needs to provide data for below fields, ·        confirm the balance at ·        issue a statement for the time period ·        address the balance confirmation letter to ·        dispatch details ·        address  check  # if the user required the balance confirmation letter for a specific date then they have to select the specific date using the calendar in the “confirm the balance at” field. # if the user required a balance confirmation for a period then they have to provide data in the “issue a statement for the time period” field # data for the “address the balance confirmation letter to” field should be selected through the drop down list as “customer” or “other”. # if the data for “address the balance confirmation letter to” field selected as “other”, then “address to” field will be displayed to the user which is a text field. # user have to select the data for “dispatch details” through the radio buttons. the following dispatch options will be displayed to the user, ·        collect from branch ·        post # if it’s selected as “collect from branch” then no fields will be displayed to the user. # if the “dispatch details” selected as “post” and data for the “address the balance confirmation letter to” field selected as “customer”, then selected customer’s registered home address and postal address will be displayed to the user. # user should be able to mark the address for which balance confirmation letter should be sent through the check box. # if the “dispatch details” selected as “post” and data for the “address the balance confirmation letter to” field selected as “other”, then user needs to provide data for below fields, ·        street address ·        district ·        city ·        province ·        zip/postal code # “street address” should be a text field and data for the “district”, “city” and “province” should be selected through the drop down list. # “reset” button allow the user to discard the entered data. # by choosing the “confirm” button, user will get a confirmation message as “are you sure you want to generate a balance confirmation letter?” ·        confirm: balance confirmation letter will be generated according to specific requirements.       .       .        cancel : process will be declined.  13. after choosing the “confirm” button, balance confirmation letter should be generated according to the company/financial institutions defined format.  14. balance confirmation letter format can be dynamically changed according to different country specifications.   15. the following details are mandatory to display in the balance confirmation letter,  ·        date  ·        to whom this letter addressed to  ·        customer details  ·        account details  ·        contact information block

description: do  # user should be able to choose the “loan account statement generate” option in the loan account management. # after login into the system, the following tabs should be displayed to the user,    search by customer   search by account   3. according to the successful search account details will be displayed to the user.   4. by choosing the “select” action, user should navigate to the “loan account statement generate” forum.  5. in the “loan account statement generate” forum, the following details should be displayed to the user,    customer name   customer reference code   account number   product   sub product   status  6. user have to select the data for “statement required from” the drop down list as “from a period” or “as at date”.  7. if it’s selected as “from a period” then “from and to date” through the calendar or it’s selected as “as at date” then user have to select the data for “as at date” from the calendar.  8. by choosing the “generate” button, loan account statement should be generated.  check  # generate button allow the user to generate a loan account statement with the following fields,     borrower information    customer name   customer address   account details    account branch   address        loan account no   account open date   account maturity date   loan amount   loan period   transaction details    transaction date   narration   reference number   value date   currency   transaction entry   transaction amount   balance

title: Lending Module | Pledging Release for Ongoing Loan & Pledge New Asset | BE DEV & BE QA
description: do  # in the lending module, user login into the system and selects the “pledging release for ongoing loan" in the account maintenance option. # the following tabs should be displayed to the user,    pledging release request   pending pledging release request    3. user should be able to search existing pledging release requests through the following search parameters,    account number   collateral ref id   customer name   cheque status  check  # according to the successful search the following details will be displayed to the user,    customer name   account number   collateral ref id   collateral name   asset type   asset sub type   status   market value   pledging exposure   remark   action – select  create new   pledging release for ongoing loan  2. in the “pledging release for ongoing loan” a create new button should be visible to the user.  3. in the “create new” forum, user able to search for a loan account using below parameters.    customer name   loan account number   identification number   customer business registration number  4. according to the successful search the following details should be displayed under below table headers,    customer name   loan account number   identification number/ br number   product   activation date   status  5. after selects a record at first section  – “facility details”  user should be able to see the details under below parameters,    customer name   loan account number   identification number/ br number   product   activation date   status   loan amount   overdue amount   penalty interest   outstanding amount   total rentals   total rentals   arrears rentals   future rentals  6. at 2nd section  – “collateral details”  user should be able to see the details under below parameters,    collateral ref id   collateral name   market valuation   asset type   asset sub type   status   pledging exposure   action   view  7. pledging exposure field should be able to edit  8.click on view action user should be able to see the below details at the pop up.    valuer type   valuation date   re valuation date   nominal value   force sale value   valuer   last valuation date   market value  9.there should be “ submit updates ” and “ previous ” button.  pledging release confirmation (accept or reject)  1. the user logs in to the system and selects a pending record at the pending pledging release request.  2. user should be able to search existing loan disbursement details through the following search parameters,    account number   cheque number   cheque status  3. when user clicks on the “select” action, user should redirect to the relevant screen to approve or reject the pending request.  4. after selects a record at first section  – “facility details”  user should be able to see the details under below parameters,    customer name   loan account number   identification number/ br number   product   activation date   status   loan amount   overdue amount   penalty interest   outstanding amount   total rentals   total rentals   arrears rentals   future rentals  5. at 2nd section  – “collateral details”  user should be able to see the details under below parameters,    collateral ref id   collateral name   market valuation   asset type   asset sub type   status   pledging exposure   action   view  6. by choosing the view action user should be able to see the below details at the pop up.    valuer type   valuation date   re valuation date   nominal value   force sale value   valuer   last valuation date   market value  7.  “approve changes”, “reject changes” and “previous” button should be visible to the user.  8. by selecting the “ approve changes ” button; the user gets a confirmation message as “are you sure you want to approve the pledging release request?”    if user click on “approve changes”, i should receive a successful message “pledging release successfully approved”  (pop up have two options approve and cancel. click on approve for approval)  9. if i click on “reject changes”, i should receive a successful message “pledging release successfully rejected” notes should be mandatory for the reject.   (pop up have two options reject and cancel. click on reject for rejection)

title: Exception Handling | Transaction Exception Triggering  | Account Transaction Exception - Duplicate Transaction - Teller Management Part II
description: do:    hardcode exception sub codes in the backend:   implement the following exception sub codes in the backend (be):  main code   atex (account transaction exception)  sub codes:    duplicate transaction   atdt   implement exception triggering:   refer to the exception triggering process flowchart for detailed steps.  trigger the appropriate exception with its sub code when the following conditions occur.    atdt   when the system detects that the same transaction has been initiated more than once within a short period (within one minute).    should check in below transactions   teller management     in house cheque clearance   miscellaneous charge   miscellaneous charge    miscellaneous charge confirmation    when triggering the above sub exception type under main exception type should save below details.    date & time of the triggered.   transaction amount   transaction   exception type & sub type   severity level   location of the transaction (exception triggered).   user who access the system when triggering.   account number cause the triggering   chanel (branch/atm/online)   module   when the exception triggered should notify the users who mapped to “exception type” based on the selected notification type and severity level.    highest severity   alert mapped users immediately and send for approval if needed and include details in inquiry.   high/ medium severity   alert mapped users end of the day and send for approval if needed and include details in inquiry.   low severity   alert mapped users end of the day and include details in inquiry.     check:    verify exception and sub exception types:   ensure that the exception and sub exception types have been created correctly in the system.  confirm that the atex code is assigned to the account transaction exception type.   confirm hardcoded exception sub codes:   check that the exception sub codes have been hardcoded in the backend as specified.   test exception triggering:   conduct thorough testing to ensure that exceptions are triggered correctly under the defined conditions.  verify that the correct exception sub codes are being generated.

description: do  # the user login into the system and choose the casa module, user have to select the “status update confirmation” option.    check  # user should navigates to the “status update confirmation” screen. # in the status update confirmation screen user should be able to view the list of already created status changes which are in pending status with following details,    customer name   account number   account name   created user (cheque leaf status update created user)   created date (order by newest to oldest)   select action   by clicking on this the details should be loaded  3. by choosing the “select” action, user will be navigating to the status update confirmation screen.  4. in the status update confirmation screen the following details will be displayed to the user,    cheque book details   cheque leaf details  5. status update confirmation was separately explained in the following urs  1003|smart link .  6. in the “cheque leaf details” forum, the following details of the selected cheque will be displayed to the user,  cheque leaf details    cheque no   current status   modified status   remark  charge details    charge type   charge amount   waive service charge   net charge amount  7. after viewing the details, by selecting the “confirm” button user will get a confirmation message as “are you sure you want update the cheque leaf status?”  a. approve: cheque leaf status will be updated  b. reject: cheque leaf status will not be updated and process will be declined.  8. if the “modified status” of the cheque displayed as “stop payment” and in the confirmation if the user selects the data for the confirmation status field as “approve”, then “confirm and print” button should be displayed at the end.   9. by choosing the “confirm and print” button, a receipt should be generated with the following details.    stop payment requested date    account holder name   account number   cheque number  10. if the user wants to reprint the stop payment cheque, then the “re print” button should be available in the status update forum.  11. generated receipt format should be varied according to different country and company requirements.

description: do  # by choosing the “select” action in the account details forum, user should navigates to the “loan account statement generate” screen.  check  # in the screen the following details of the selected account will be displayed to the user,    customer name   customer reference code   account number    module   product   sub product   status  2. user have to select data for the “statement required from” field through the drop down list as “as per date” or “for a period”.  3. if the data for “statement required from” field selected as “as at date”, then “as at date” will be displayed to the user and they have to select a specific date through the calendar.   4. if the user chooses the data for “statement required from” field as “for a period”, then user needs to provide data for “from and to date” through the calendar.  5. by choosing the “generate” button, a loan account statement will be generated and displayed to the user.

title: Lending Module | Loan Account Statement Generate & Printing | Search By Customer & Search By Account (FE DEV & FE QA)
description: do  # in the home screen user should be able to choose the “lending” module. # in the “lending” module, user will be able to choose the “loan account statement generate” option inside the loan account management. # after login into the system, the following tabs should be displayed to the user,     search by customer    search by account  check  scenario 1   search by customer  # in this scenario, we consider that the user should be able to choose the “search by customer” option. # in this tab, user should be able to search an existing customer through the following search parameter,    customer name   customer identification number    customer reference code    customer business registration number  3. according to the successful search, the following customer details will be displayed to the user,    customer name   customer reference code   dob/business registration date   customer identification number   kyc status   status   action (select)  4. by choosing the “select” action, user should navigates to the “account details” forum.  5. in the “account details” forum, all the available loan accounts for the selected customer will be displayed.  6. “account details” forum display the following details,    module   product    sub product    account number   status   action (select)  scenario 2   search by account  # in this scenario, we consider that the user should be able to choose the “search by account” option. # in the “search by account” option, user should be able to choose a particular loan account through the “account number” search parameter. # according to the successful search the following details of the loan account will be displayed to the user,    module   product   sub product   account number    status    action (select)  4. in both scenario 1 & scenario 2 after choosing a specific account in the “account details” forum, user should navigates to the “loan account statement generate” screen.

title: Proceeds Handling | Payment of Loan Proceeds to a Third Party - Development
description: do:     in the existing loan disbursement procedure within the lending module, upon activating a loan, users can confirm the disbursement using the "confirm disbursement" feature within the lending module.   the modification outlined below is necessary to facilitate the handling of third party disbursements into other banks during the disbursement confirmation process.   modification 1     while confirming third party (internal and other bank ) disbursements, system automatically check whether customer has mapped a savings account or not.   if the customer’s loan disbursement account was not mapped in disbursement details entering screen, a validation message should be displayed at disbursement confirmation that  " customer’s loan disbursement casa account was not found”  (the procedure for entering the other third party disbursement information into the loan appraisal has been documented in urs   pf 2994. kindly refer to this urs for more comprehensive details on other third party payment information.)    if customer has savings account record should be passed to “disbursement payment process” in casa module and below api should be invoked.   transfer in/swagger ui.html#/loan disbursement controller/converttotransactionsusingpost3    when invoking the api below parameters should be passed.          ],      "rate": "string"    },    "meemail": "string",    "meusername": "string",    "messages": "string",    "narrative": "string",    "netamount": "string",    "notificationdetail": "string",    "subproductidentification": "string",    "tax": "string",    "transactionamount": "string",    "transactioncurrencycode": "string",    "transactioncurrencyid": "string",    "transactionreference": "string",    "username": "string"  }       module name parameters should be mentioned below.         fuxlending – if parameters passed from fusionx lending module, module name should be fuxlending.         fulending   if parameters passed from fusion lending module, module name should be fulending.    after the successful request of the above mentioned api, the disbursement amount of the other third party payment should be credited to the customer's internal savings account.   additionally, an automatic fund reservation should be initiated for the third party disbursement amount until the completion of third party transfers from other banks the customer's savings account to the destination bank account.   this process has already been implemented in the fusion to fusionx lending loan disbursement integration, and the same approach can be applied here   by selecting the “ confirm ” button; the user gets a confirmation message as “payment confirmation is successful”.    “back ” button should be there to navigate to previous page.   if customer does not have a savings account, a validation message should be displayed as "" customer’s loan disbursement casa account was not found.”     check:     while confirming third party (internal and other bank ) disbursements, system automatically check whether customer has mapped a savings account or not. check it   if the customer’s loan disbursement account was not mapped in disbursement details entering screen, a validation message should be displayed at disbursement confirmation that  " customer’s loan disbursement casa account was not found” check it   if customer has savings account record should be passed to “disbursement payment process” in casa module and above api should be invoked. check it

title: Schedule log update (FrontEnd) | Initial Screen
description: do:  once the user selects the required module from the lov, the created records should be displayed in the table    check;  check if the user can select the modules from the given lov in the initial screen.  check if the data loads into the table

title: Schedule log update (FrontEnd) | Update Screen
description: do;    the user can click on the ‘select’ option under the action header in the initial screen, to navigate to the schedule update page.   the frequency type can be edited, the user can select the type from the given drop down.   there should be an editable numeric field in the ‘unit’ field where the user can enter the schedule time the record must start working.   the next execution date field can be edited, where the user can edit the next date and the schedule should run.   check;    check if the view field types are un editable    check if the user can select the record from the initial screen    check if the update button saves the progress and update the current record    check if the back button navigates the user to the previous screen

title: Schedule log update (FrontEnd) | Create screen
description: do:    the user selects the ‘schedule log’ menu under the ‘schedules’ header, which then the user is directed to the schedule log initial screen   in the initial screen the user must be able to select the module in the given lov which has the following parameters,         ·         casa         ·         lending         ·         term deposit      in there the user must first select a schedule name data for this drop down should be taken from the schedule events created under the selected module     then the user should fill the ‘unit’ numeric field which is there to specify from how long the schedule should start working. for eg: if the frequency is date, in the unit’s user can select the from how many days the schedule should run   next the user is able see the ‘last execution date & time’ (this is a view only field) if there is no previous log, the current date should be displayed.   then the user can add the next execution date, that means from which date the schedule should initiate.          if the schedule is already running, the next execution date & time should be shown in the field according to the selection of the frequency type and unit selected    check:      check if the user can click on 'create new' to create a new schedule record   check if the status of the record is default active, the user can activate or deactivate it to their preference.   there should be a validation in the records, where the user cannot create another schedule with the same frequency type for under the same schedule name. there cannot be the same combination duplicated, if the user wishes to either one of the records must be inactive, a validation should fire as  “record already exist”  and should not let the user continue.

title: Lending Module | Pledging Release for Ongoing Loan & Pledge New Asset | Pledging Release Confirmation
description: do  # the user logs in to the system and selects a pending record at the pending pledging release request. # user able to search the existing loan disbursement details.    account number   cheque number   cheque status  check  # according to the successful search the details of the already created pending pledging requests will be  displayed with the following fields, #  account number #  account name #  created user (cheque leaf status update created user) #  created date (order by newest to oldest) #  created time #  select action  (by clicking on this the details should be loaded.) #  when user clicks on the “select” action, user should redirect to the relevant screen to approve or reject the pending request. # after selects a record,  user should be able to view the following details in the  “facility details”  forum, #  customer name #  loan account number #  identification number/ br number #  product #  activation date #  status #  loan amount #  overdue amount #  penalty interest #  outstanding amount #  total rentals #  total rentals #  arrears rentals #  future rentals #   “collateral details”  user should be able to see the details under below parameters, #  collateral ref id #  collateral name #  market valuation #  asset type #  asset sub type #  status #  pledging exposure #  action   view # by choosing the view action, user should be able to see the below details at the pop up. #  valuer type #  valuation date #  re valuation date #  nominal value #  force sale value #  valuer #  last valuation date #  market value # there should be “approve changes”, “reject changes” and “previous” button. # by selecting the “ approve changes ” button; the user gets a confirmation message as “are you sure you want to approve the pledging release request?”   a. approve →  i should receive a successful message “pledging release successfully approved”   b. cancel → pledging release will not be approved and process will be cancelled. # by selecting the “reject changes” button; the user gets a confirmation message as “are you sure you want to reject the pledging release request?”           a. reject → i should receive a successful message as “pledging release successfully rejected” notes should be mandatory for the reject.           b. cancel → pledging release will not be rejected and process will be cancelled.  9. if the user wants to “reject changes”, then “notes” will be a mandatory field.  10.user should have permission to log in to the system. if not validations should fire for the provided information.  11. once approved the pending grid must be refreshed for new data and the approved record must not be available.  12. approved user/date/time should save automatically.

title: Lending Module | Pledging Release for Ongoing Loan & Pledge New Asset | Create New Pledging Request
description: do  # the user logs in to the system and clicks the pledging release for ongoing loan at the account maintenance. # once loading the page click on create new button a pop up will appear to select the loan account.    check  # in the pop up user will be able to search for a loan account using below parameters.    customer name   loan account number   identification number   customer business registration number   2. according to the successful search the following details will be displayed to the user,    customer name   loan account number   identification number/ br number   product   activation date   status   action (select)  3. by choosing the “select” action, user will be navigate to the  “facility details” forum.  4. in the “facility details”, the following details will be displayed to the user,    customer name   loan account number   identification number/ br number   product   activation date   status   loan amount   overdue amount   penalty interest   outstanding amount   total rentals   total rentals   arrears rentals   future rentals  5.  after viewing the “facility details”, user should be able to view  “collateral details” under below parameters,    collateral ref id   collateral name   market valuation   asset type   asset sub type   status   pledging exposure   action (view)  6. pledging exposure field should be a editable field.  7. by choosing the view action user should be able to see the below details at the pop up.    valuer type   valuation date   re valuation date   nominal value   force sale value   valuer   last valuation date   market value  8.there should be “ submit updates ” and “ previous ” button.  9. the system must not allow create the duplicate pending status changes. a message “pending record exist. please approve the pending record”  10. market value & total outstanding should validate to the pledging exposure when try to reduce the amount.  11. user should have permission to log in to the system. if not, validations should fire for the provided information.  12.data should save successfully.  13.created user/date/time should save automatically.

title: Lending Module | Pledging Release for Ongoing Loan & Pledge New Asset | Pledging Release Request & Pending Pledging Release Request  | View
description: do  #  the user logs in to the system and clicks the pledging release for ongoing loan at the account maintenance in the lending module.  check  # in the page user should be able to see the table header with the following tabs,    pending pledging release requests   pledging release for ongoing loan  scenario 1   pending pledging release requests  do  # in this scenario consider that the user should be able to choose the  “pending pledging release request” option. # user should be able to search pending pledging release requests through the following search parameters,    account number   collateral ref id   customer name   cheque status  check  # according to the successful search the following details will be displayed to the user,    customer name   account number   collateral ref id   collateral name   asset type   asset sub type   status   market value   pledging exposure   action – select   (initially, on this screen should not load any records select to the user)   2. when user clicks on the “select” action, user should redirect to the view screen. (similar to the create screen with un editable pledging exposure fields.)  scenario 2   pledging release for ongoing loan  do  # in this scenario consider that the user should be able to choose the  “pledging release for ongoing loan” option. # user able to search the pending pledging release request through the following search parameters,    account number   collateral ref id   customer name   cheque status  check  # according to the successful search the following details should be displayed to the user,    customer name    account number    collateral ref id    collateral name    asset type    asset sub type    status    market value    pledging exposure    remark    action   select  2. when user clicks on the “select” action, user should redirect to the relevant screen to approve or reject the pending request

description: do    add the following fields to the filtering parameters:   created user (user id)   excess type (drop down – allocate/excess/refund)   lending account no   ensure these fields are optional.   add the following columns to the generated report:   excess type (excesstype)   receipt amount (receiptamount from receiptexcessdetail)   refund amount (allocatedrefundamount from receiptexcessdetail)   created user (createduser)   created date and time (createddate from receiptexcessdetail)    extract data from the "receiptexcessdetail" table under "anrkrlendingaccount."    separate thousands for "receipt amount" and "refund amount."   display only two decimal places for these values in the report.   ensure the "created user" is visible exactly as it is in the table.   format the "created date and time" column as dd mm yyyy thh:mm.  checks    verify that the report filters details according to the input parameters.   confirm that the report is generated based on the entered inputs.   confirm that there are no mandatory triggers, as the additional input fields should be optional.   confirm the successful generation of the report according to the entered inputs.

Loan Finance | Scheduler Charges Debits for Loans | Approve Screen | BE & FE QA
description: do   ·         after the user creates the debit charge, the user clicks on the submit button and then the created report should be sent for 'pending request'.  ·         there is an approval officer to approve pending requests in the 'pending requests' section of the waiting process.  ·         if the approval officer didn’t approve the record before the debit charge date the record will expire and the user must create another new record or update the existing record for the charges apply.  ·         approval officer must select the action from ‘approve’ or ‘reject’ from the given lov  ·         if the reports are 'approved', a 'reporting success' message should be added. if the report is 'rejected', a message should be added saying "reporting successfully rejected".  ·         if the report is marked as declined, the status should be changed to 'rejected' however the user should be able to update the report and reactivate it if required.  ·         once the report is approved or rejected, the report should be displayed on the initial screen of debit charges along with the status.  ·         all other procedures are same except the mentioned ones are different.  ·         "confirm", button should be added to save account details.  ·         "back" button should be added to go to previous page      check   ·         confirm the process of creating a debit charge and submitting it for a 'pending request.'  ·         verify the existence of an approval officer who can approve or reject pending requests.  ·         check if, in case of non approval before the debit charge date, the record expires and the user can create a new record or update an existing one.  ·         confirm that the approval officer must select the action from 'approve' or 'reject' from the given lov.  ·         check if a successful message is displayed for approved records: "record successfully approved."  ·         check if a successful message is displayed for rejected records: "record successfully rejected."  ·         confirm that if a record is marked as rejected, the status turns to 'rejected,' and the user can update the record and activate it again if necessary.  ·         verify that once the record is approved or rejected, it is displayed in the initial screen of the debit charges with the updated status.  ·         confirm that all other processes remain the same as before, and only the mentioned changes are applied.

title: Loan Finance | Scheduler Charges Debits for Loans | Cancel Screen | BE & FE QA
description: do   add a 'cancel' button under the action header for the user to select a record from the grid and click.  once it is selected the user is navigated to the cancelation page where the type of debit charge is shown this should be displayed in a view only format and the following should be editable, o batch number o group reference o comments o cancel comment add cancel button and remark option. clicking on cancel should add a popup warning saying "are you sure you want to cancel"  this will cancel this debit request and remove this record. do you want to continue?' the user should be able to click on confirm if the process is successful and should display a success message, otherwise an error message should be displayed. once the user cancels a record it should not be recoverable. all other process is same as before, only mentioned changes apply.   check  after the user selects a record from the grid and clicks the 'cancel' button under the header, verify that the user is navigated to the cancellation page. check that the following fields are editable on the cancellation pageල o batch number o batch reference o remarks o cancel comment   verify that the user can cancel by entering 'cancel remarks' and clicking on the cancel button. confirm the presence of a pop up warning when clicked on cancel, displaying the message: "are you sure you want to cancel? this will cancel this debit charge request and remove this record. do you want to continue?"  check if the user can click on "confirm" if the cancelation process is successful, resulting in a success message: "record cancelled successfully." if the cancelation process is unsuccessful, verify that an error message is shown: "something went wrong, please try again." confirm that once the user cancels a record, it cannot be taken back again. verify that all other processes remain the same as before, and only the mentioned changes are applied.

Account Module | Processing Sweep In | Account Sweep In – Action Points - Inward
description: do:   should create a schedule process for the sweeps in.  when a cheque came and request a sweep in needed amount from the savings account should hold (if the savings account surpass the required minimum levels and fund amounts) and should release the payment.  when the batch process occurs, following transaction scheduled batch processes should occurs.  set 1:  ·         debit savings accounts (to the extent of shortfall amount ( ))  ·         credit current account (to the extent of shortfall amount ())  set 2:  ·         debit current account (transaction amount)  ·         credit savings account (transaction amount)  set 3:  ·         debit current accounts (to the extent of shortfall amount ( ))  ·         credit current account (to the extent of shortfall amount ())  set 4:  ·         debit current account (transaction amount)  ·         credit current account (transaction amount)  sweep out (set 2) or the sweep in reversal should be the process that reverse the amount that credited back to the “from account” (savings account).  should be able to map the related transaction event/ process schedule/ and process schedule event for the batch process.  account status mapped to the sweep in event should be able to get to the sweep – in process.  the expectation of the scheduler as follows.  should be able to run the batch process as the scheduler setup.  data should save successfully.  the action points are as below,   inward  > batch validation  > file stepper  > select action – view and then should select the record status as realized and then the account balance is not sufficient a pop should appear by asking “are you sure you want to process sweep?” if user click on authorize, should happen the process sweep in.       check:   verify that the sweep in process transfers funds from the specified source account to the target account.  confirm that the sweep out process transfers funds from the specified source account to the target account.  check all the data tables updated successfully.

Loan Finance | Loan Charges Payable Confirmation | Update
description: do:   the user login into the system.  then select the loan charges payable confirmation.  transaction management  > loan charges payable confirmation → update  should be able to view the loan account details.  ·         account number  ·         sub product  ·         third party payment type  ·         payable amount  ·         status  ·         amount  ·         action   view / remove    ·         batch number  ·         batch reference  ·         remarks  ·         payable amount – amount that should pay  ·         amount – paid amount by customer  payable amount is the amount that customer should paid. and the amount is the amount that customer has paid. customer should be able to pay a partial amount if they needed.  records should be able to maintain if the customer paid part by part should be able to pay by the customer payment happened.  if the customer did a partially payment the rest amount should be as a debit to settle in future.   for the search results should load the debits (there may be multiple debits for a contract)  amount fields should be editable on the table as i can change the details before submitting loan charges payable request  batch number is auto generated. batch reference number should be editable.  when selecting the “apply to all”, selected all accounts should apply to the loan charges payable details.  save button should be there to save all the details. by selecting the “ update ” button; the user gets a confirmation message as “are you sure you want to update new loan charges payable confirmation?”  there should be two options in the confirmation message “ ok ” and “ cancel ”     o   if i click on “ok”, i should receive a successful message “entered record has been successfully applied & saved”  o   if not saved successfully, i should receive an unsuccessful message “unsuccessful transaction”  o   if i click on “cancel”, i should stay in the creation page.     if the transaction is failed, then need to response as “unsuccessful transaction”  “ update ” button should be there to save the details; it helps to save the details without submit.  “ submit ” button should be there to submit the request for approval  “ back ” button should be there to clear all the details and navigate to loan charges inquiry page.  “ reset ” button should be there to clear all entered the details.  “ back ” button in view account details page navigate to creation page.  synced date should be saved.  updated date time should save in a log table.  if some details to add after clicking the  “confirm”  button without entering mandatory details user unable to save it and system should pop up required messages under the field. message “please enter a value”  related error messages should available.  records should be able to be searched, viewed, submitted and approved.      check:   should be able to search and select check it.  check if user be able to updated for the selected bulk.  check the validations and error messages.

description: do  # user should be able to login into the system and selects the “settings” option. # in the “settings”, user should be able to choose the “charge type definition” option inside the central cash management settings. # by choosing the “create new” button in the view screen, user should be navigate to the create new screen. # in the create new screen, user needs to provide data for below fields,    code   name   description   transaction code   transaction sub code   amount   status  update  # if the user selects the “update” option in the view screen, for an existing record, then the user will be navigate to the update screen of the selected record.    check  view  # in the view screen according to the successful search the following details of the existing charge type definition will be displayed to the user,    item code   name   description   status   action (view | update record)  create new  # in the create new screen, user should be able to enter the code. code should be 4 digit code and should not be duplicated. # user should be able to enter the charge name information, in the text field. # charge description should be entered in the text box. # transaction code should be selected from the drop down list, transaction code can be retrieved from transaction code master. # user should be able to select transaction sub code according to the main transaction code. sub transaction code can be retrieved from sub transaction code master. # the amount field must be optional field where user can define a standard fee which deduct manually. # same transaction code and sub code cannot be mapped for different charge type in charge type under “active” status. duplicate should be validate. # created user and time should be capture based on login details. # only authorized user should be able to login into the system and create a new record.  update  # in the “update” forum, except the “code” , all the other fields can be updated. # description: do   ·         after the user creates the debit charge, the user clicks on the submit button and then the created report should be sent for 'pending request'.  ·         there is an approval officer to approve pending requests in the 'pending requests' section of the waiting process.  ·         if the approval officer didn’t approve the record before the debit charge date the record will expire and the user must create another new record or update the existing record for the charges apply.  ·         approval officer must select the action from ‘approve’ or ‘reject’ from the given lov  ·         if the reports are 'approved', a 'reporting success' message should be added. if the report is 'rejected', a message should be added saying "reporting successfully rejected".  ·         if the report is marked as declined, the status should be changed to 'rejected' however the user should be able to update the report and reactivate it if required.  ·         once the report is approved or rejected, the report should be displayed on the initial screen of debit charges along with the status.  ·         all other procedures are same except the mentioned ones are different.  ·         "confirm", button should be added to save account details.  ·         "back" button should be added to go to previous page     check   ·         confirm the process of creating a debit charge and submitting it for a 'pending request.'  ·         verify the existence of an approval officer who can approve or reject pending requests.  ·         check if, in case of non approval before the debit charge date, the record expires and the user can create a new record or update an existing one.  ·         confirm that the approval officer must select the action from 'approve' or 'reject' from the given lov.  ·         check if a successful message is displayed for approved records: "record successfully approved."  ·         check if a successful message is displayed for rejected records: "record successfully rejected."  ·         confirm that if a record is marked as rejected, the status turns to 'rejected,' and the user can update the record and activate it again if necessary.  ·         verify that once the record is approved or rejected, it is displayed in the initial screen of the debit charges with the updated status.  ·         confirm that all other processes remain the same as before, and only the mentioned changes are applied.
